firm_data.name: Fundingtraders.com
firm_data.description: Funding Traders is a prop firm offering evaluations to aspiring traders who wish to prove their skills and get access to live capital. FT offers upto $2m funding, 1 and 2 step phases, 1:100 leverage, trading dashbaord, news allowed, weekend trading allowed and much more. Join today and start your journey to success.

reviews.title: Support team is responsive
reviews.content: The customer support team is responsive and actually helpful, resolving issues promptly. The trading platform is stable and the rules are transparent and trader-friendly. Thanks for Ced, Khalifa, Obiwan, Lance and billy.

reviews.title: Fantastic Prop Firm Experience!
reviews.content: Fundingtrader provided a clear, achievable evaluation process that genuinely prepared you for live trading. Their payout structure is among the best in the industry and withdrawals are processed incredibly fast. Thanks to all available and responsive support. I appreciate Khalifa, Oxking and Obiwan on the community channel and I appreciate billy, Leo and Ebi on the live chat.

reviews.title: What an amazing platform
reviews.content: This is an amazing platform for every trader out there. I hope everyone see this. Khalifa & Ebi made everything so clear and other support like Obiwan, magnesium and billy also assisted me. And they are very fast.

reviews.title: Another challenge account passed
reviews.content: This is the only firm I trust with all my heart. Thanks to Ms Khalifa and Pat for the amazing tour help. Billy, magnesium, Obiwan made sure I received my funded account instantly.

reviews.title: ’ve had a positive experience with…
reviews.content: ’ve had a positive experience with Funding Traders and they offer a variety of funding options tailored to different trading styles. Their platform is user-friendly, with clear rules and solid risk management guidelines. Payouts have been reliable and timely, and their support team is responsive and helpful. It’s a great opportunity for skilled traders looking to grow without risking personal capital.

reviews.title: I would like to share my experience…
reviews.content: I would like to share my experience with Funding Traders Propfirm. Yesterday I bought an account with crypto payment. I paid but the trading account did not receive. I kept waiting for the account to receive. The next morning, I still did not receive it. So I sent an email to their support. Their customer service was very helpful. "CED & KID" helped me with everything until I received my account. I was disappointed that I did not receive it immediately when I purchased the account, but I am satisfied with their customer service.

reviews.content: Good company and good support. Special thanks to lcx04 and everyone else for helping. No spread, good platform for trading.

reviews.title: I just bought a 2-step Next-Gen…
reviews.content: I just bought a 2-step Next-Gen account. I consider it one of the companies with the best conditions. The profit target is 8% for the first phase and 5% for the second phase, and one great feature is the maximum allowed drawdown, which is 12%. It also allows copy trading, in case you have multiple accounts with this firm or with others.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader Thank you so much for your positive review and for choosing our 2-step Next-Gen account! We're thrilled to hear you appreciate the favorable trading conditions, including the realistic profit targets and we're glad that the copy trading feature is making it easier to manage multiple accounts seamlessly. Your feedback means a lot to us as we continue striving to offer the best possible experience for all our traders. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. We appreciate your trust in us! FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: FundingTraders is the Scammer broker
reviews.content: FundingTraders is the worst broker. I buy $10,000 instant-funded account. The account is going perfectly. I make $200 profit again i take 2 trades. one trades go in loss of around $50 and other $70. The trades till open. The broker breached the loss limit and closed my account. The account balance till $10,200+.This is the worst broker. Don't buy a Fundintraders account. They are scammer.Scammer.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader We appreciate you sharing your experience, but we must clarify the facts to provide the community with an accurate understanding. Our risk management rules, including loss limits, are clearly outlined in our Terms of Service and Help Center for every funded account, including instant-funded ones. These limits are in place to protect both the traders and the firm by ensuring responsible, sustainable trading. When an account reaches a loss threshold, even if there is an open profit on other trades, the net risk exposure is what determines compliance, not just individual open trades or profit alone. This is standard practice across legitimate prop firms and is designed to maintain fair trading conditions. Your account was managed according to these transparent rules, and any closure was the result of meeting those pre-set risk parameters. It is incorrect to label FundingTraders as a scam based on a clearly communicated risk policy that all traders agree to before funding. If you would like further clarification about how loss limits and account management work, please review our Terms of Service and Help Center. Our Risk Management Team is always available to assist with any questions or concerns. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Funding traders is a complete SCAM!!!
reviews.content: Funding traders is a complete SCAM!!!! Everything seem to go well until you request payout. They denied me my payout base on false accusation of copy trading from a group of traders trading with same IP address in Nigeria. I submited all evidence showing my trading location which totally isn't related to what I was accused of. After 21days, I was blocked and banned without proof or explanation. They are absolute SCAMMERS!!!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader We understand your concerns, but please note that we operate with strict adherence to our Terms of Service and Risk Management policies to ensure a fair and secure trading environment for all users. Our system continuously monitors accounts for compliance with the rule prohibiting copy trading or coordinated trading activity, including trades executed with the same IP address or highly similar entries and exits within short time frames, as outlined in our TOS. These measures protect the integrity of our evaluation and funding programs. When a suspected violation occurs, a thorough investigation is conducted that includes reviewing submitted evidence such as trading locations. If the evidence does not corroborate the user's claims or fails to refute coordinated trading concerns, actions including payout denial and account termination may be taken in full compliance. We uphold these standards to maintain a stable and consistent trading environment. We regret if communication during the investigation did not meet your expectations. Our Help Center and support team aim to provide clear explanations and timely responses. Blocking or banning accounts only occurs after careful review and due process, ensuring adherence to our policies. We encourage all users to review our Terms of Service and Risk Management guidelines carefully before and during participation in our programs, as acceptance of these terms is mandatory upon registration. Our commitment is to fairness, transparency, and the long-term success of our traders. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Disappointing Experience with Unexpected Spread Behavior
reviews.content: I recently took part in a $100K challenge with Fundingtraders.com. On July 3rd, I placed a SELL trade on EURUSD at 10:25 AM. As the trade moved in my favor, I adjusted my stop loss to lock in a 1:1 risk-reward ratio.However, during the trade, I experienced an unusually large spread spike, far beyond the typical range I’ve observed for EURUSD (usually around 1-5 points). But in this instance, the spread inexplicably exceeded 20 points which is about 2pips. My trade was closed as a result of this sudden spread widening, which was highly unexpected. Moments after I was stopped out, the spread returned to normal levels. The price then continued in the direction I had anticipated, which was frustrating to witness as it would have allowed me to pass the challenge.This experience has left me concerned about the trading conditions and overall reliability of this firm’s platform. I recommend anyone considering them to carefully review their terms and be cautious about sudden market behavior.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We understand how frustrating it can be to see a trade impacted by spread fluctuations, especially during a critical challenge phase. However, we’d like to provide some important context to help clarify the situation. Spread widening is a normal part of live market conditions and is not controlled or manipulated by our platform. Spreads can temporarily expand during periods of high volatility, economic news releases, or reduced liquidity, even on commonly traded pairs like EURUSD. These fluctuations are determined by our liquidity providers and are part of real market dynamics, not anomalies. Our platform uses institutional-grade pricing feeds, and all trades, including stop-loss triggers, are executed based on live bid/ask data received from those providers. While we understand it’s frustrating that the spread spike closed your trade prematurely, this was not the result of an error or malfunction, but a reflection of real market conditions that every trader is subject to. We encourage all traders to account for potential spread variations in their risk management strategies, particularly when setting tight stop losses. We remain committed to providing fair and realistic trading conditions, and we appreciate your feedback as we continue to improve the trader experience. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We understand your frustration, but the statements made here are inaccurate and misleading. We have successfully processed thousands of payouts, many of which are well-documented by traders who followed the rules and complied with our Terms of Service. Our Risk Management protocols are clearly outlined in both the TOS and Help Center, and they exist to ensure fairness and sustainability for all participants. Claims of bans without reason or ignored emails are not consistent with how we operate. We maintain active support channels and respond to all inquiries, though complex cases may require more time due to internal reviews. Regarding copy trading or trade mirroring, our system does not flag traders based solely on similar trades. Reviews are based on detailed server-side data, including trade timing, lot sizes, device usage, and IP behavior. With over a million traders globally, our detection tools are calibrated to identify patterns far beyond random overlap, we do not take action unless there's verifiable evidence of coordinated behavior. Discord bans only occur when users violate our community guidelines, including spreading false information or using abusive language. We always encourage traders to reach out through official channels for support or appeals, and we remain committed to maintaining a fair and transparent environment for all. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We appreciate your feedback, but we must respectfully correct several serious inaccuracies in your statement. Our payout process is clearly outlined in our Terms of Service and Help Center, and every trader agrees to these conditions before beginning their challenge or funded account. We do not withhold profits arbitrarily, all payouts are processed once the trader meets the outlined criteria and remains in compliance with our rules, which are fully transparent and publicly accessible. Your account was reviewed by our Risk Management Team after a flagged violation of trading behavior that directly breached the terms agreed upon. This was not a “hidden rule”, it was clearly stated and applied equally to all traders. When violations occur, payouts are placed on hold pending full investigation. If the breach is confirmed, the account is closed in accordance with the TOS. We do not pay out profits on accounts that violated core trading rules, as doing so would undermine the integrity of our program. The suggestion that we only pay small profits and block larger ones is false and unsupported, many traders have received substantial payouts, which are verifiable across multiple platforms and testimonials. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Really important
reviews.content: Execution Issue: Adverse Slippage I'm reporting systematic execution problems with your platform since 4 days ago. I know you have changed something and now you are manipulating the charts. I've been working with you since December last year and this started 4 days ago.1. Consistent Adverse Slippage:BUY orders consistently execute higher than the displayed price. SELL orders consistently execute lower than the displayed price. This is a clear pattern, not random market slippage. 2. Execution at Non-Existent Price (Proof): Specific Incident: EUR/USD.This is unacceptable and requires investigation.Please: 1. Explain this consistent adverse slippage. 2. Provide the fill report (timestamp, liquidity source) for the EUR/USD trade @ 1.17444 3. Confirm if your execution feed matches the chart feed. I have proof of what I'm writing down here.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for reaching out. We understand how important execution quality is to our traders, and we want to address your concerns directly. Our execution model has not changed, and there have been no modifications to the pricing engine or liquidity routing in the past week. All trades are executed through aggregated liquidity providers using institutional-grade pricing. Slippage, both positive and negative, is a natural part of trading, especially during volatile periods, news releases, or low-liquidity windows. Please note that execution prices are based on the real-time bid/ask spread at the moment of order fill. Chart printed data often reflects only the bid price and does not account for the spread, which can lead to perceived discrepancies between what you see on the chart and the actual fill price. This is a known and standard behavior across all trading platforms. We want to assure you that we do not and never have manipulated pricing or chart data. Our top priority is transparency, fairness, and the success of our traders. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Execution Issue: Adverse Slippage & Non-Chart Price (Proof Attached)
reviews.content: I'm reporting systematic execution problems with your platform:1.  Consistent Adverse Slippage:    BUY orders consistently execute higher than the displayed price.         SELL orders consistently execute lower than the displayed price.         This is a clear pattern, not random market slippage.  2.  Execution at Non-Existent Price (Proof):        Specific Incident: USD/JPY trade closed at 142.829.         Problem: My chart data shows no candle reached 142.829 during that period (evidence attached).  This is unacceptable and requires investigation.Please:  1.  Explain this consistent adverse slippage.  2.  Provide the fill report (timestamp, liquidity source) for the USD/JPY trade @ 142.829.  3.  Confirm if your execution feed matches the chart feed.  I have proof of the USD/JPY discrepancy.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for bringing this to our attention. However, we’d like to clarify several important details to address the concerns you've raised. All trade executions on our platform are routed through liquidity providers using real-time market data feeds. Slippage, both positive and negative, is a normal part of trading during volatile or fast-moving market conditions. Claims of “consistent adverse slippage” are not supported by platform-wide data. In fact, many traders benefit from positive slippage under the same conditions. Our systems do not manipulate execution in favor of or against any trader. While your chart feed may not display a visible candle at that exact price, it’s important to understand that charts are often constructed using filtered or averaged pricing (typically bid prices), whereas executions depend on real-time tick-by-tick pricing, which can include bid, ask, and spread variations. This discrepancy is normal and expected across all professional platforms. To reiterate, there is no systematic issue with our execution engine, and all trades are processed fairly under real market conditions. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Legal Scammers
reviews.content: Passed to funded stage on 100k challenge.Downsized me to 50k stating that I traded with no SL and it was risky trading. Their own rules state that stop losses aren’t needed as people use EA’s to manage risk. After requesting a payout they denied my request and banned my account stating I was using an EA to trade that wasn’t allowed. I was never using an EA I just told them their own rules state SL’s aren’t needed as EA’s do it.After this they asked for proof of my EA including source code I told them my account with them is NextGen I don’t use an EA and sent them an excel that I use to calculate my position sizes. They said this wasn’t adequate and then banned my account and stopped replying. Stay away from these cheap firms love to take your money, hate when they’ve to pay it back out.Account ID: 15403Payout ID: 1845
reviews.reply_content: Hey Micheal, We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, but we must correct several inaccuracies in your statement. Your account was not downgraded or banned without justification. Our risk team identified a trading pattern consistent with the use of an unauthorized Expert Advisor (EA), which is a direct violation of our terms, particularly when the source or logic of the EA cannot be verified. While we do not require a stop loss on every trade, we do require that traders demonstrate responsible risk management, whether manual or automated. When asked to provide evidence clarifying your trading method, the materials submitted did not sufficiently explain the automated behavior observed on the account. As a result, and in line with our policies, your account was closed. We take these matters seriously and maintain strict standards to ensure a fair environment for all traders. We remain fully committed to paying out compliant traders and continue to do so every single day. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: CONFIRMED SCAM - Read carefully
reviews.content: I bought an account from this company, completed the challenges following their rules, and have worked on a funded account with them.I even made some withdrawals with no issues (smaller amounts). The problem came when the amount was larger.In this case, the withdrawal ( i can attach screenshots, all is documented ) was for $7,362 and was requested on May 20th. They claim to pay within 24–48 hours.What happened? They haven’t paid. It’s that simple.I’ve followed all the rules they require. I haven’t broken a single one. I have everything documented and recorded (I will soon add a link to a video on a well-known trader's YouTube channel sharing my experience — stay tuned).Their only reply is that they are very busy handling other requests and that they’ll get back to me soon… Time goes by, and I keep receiving the same responses. No one takes responsibility. It’s a shame that companies like this end up scamming those who trusted them. I’ve lost $7,300, which took me a lot of effort and dedication to earn. I truly hope my experience helps you avoid buying anything from this company. Today it was me — tomorrow it could be you.Best regards.Updated: 7 weeks “checking” my account? Strange. I re-confirm my opinion. STAY FAR FROM THIS COMPANY, next time they unpayed can be you.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Raul, We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, but we must respectfully address the misinformation presented. Your payout request is not being ignored, nor is there any attempt to avoid payment. Our records show that your case is currently under review due to account activity that raised internal compliance flags, a standard part of our security and verification process, especially for higher payout amounts. This review is not punitive, but procedural, and ensures that all payouts are issued to traders who remain fully within our terms. We understand the frustration around delays and are actively working to finalize your case. While we strive to process all payouts within 24–48 hours, complex reviews may take longer, and we communicate that transparently. We have a consistent history of paying out traders who meet the guidelines, including many larger withdrawals, and we stand by our integrity. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We appreciate your feedback, but the information provided is not accurate. Our trading platform operates with real market conditions, including spread fluctuations and occasional slippage, both of which are standard across all brokers, especially during periods of low liquidity or high volatility. In this particular case, the trade was closed in accordance with live market pricing and spread behavior at the time. The platform did not force-close your trade arbitrarily, and our team thoroughly reviewed the pricing data before responding. As noted in our TOS, managing risk, including understanding the impact of spreads, is ultimately the trader's responsibility. While we understand your frustration, no policy or system error occurred here, and no funds were unfairly deducted. We remain fully transparent and committed to supporting traders who operate within the rules and market dynamics. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Here's your message translated into…
reviews.content: Here's your message translated into English clearly and with impact:---Everything was going well until I submitted a withdrawal request.I requested a withdrawal of $1,500, and my capital was $10,000.However, they told me that I was copying trades because there were 4 similar trades with another account — which is completely illogical and illegal.This company is a scam, scam, scam! I warn all traders: do not buy from them. Everything changes when you try to withdraw your funds, and their excuses make no sense.They even banned me from the Telegram group. I joined again with another account to explain their failure — and they banned me again.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We’re sorry to hear about your frustration, but your claims are completely inaccurate. Our system flags accounts only when there is clear, repeated evidence of mirrored trading behavior, which violates the rules every trader agrees to before starting. Simply having a few similar trades is not enough to trigger action, only when patterns of systematic copy trading are confirmed across multiple accounts is any restriction applied. As for your ban from the Telegram group: users who violate community guidelines by spreading false or inflammatory claims are subject to removal, especially when they rejoin under alternate accounts to bypass moderation. We are committed to maintaining a respectful, professional space for serious traders. We’ve paid out millions of dollars to funded traders and continue to support a thriving global community. If you have genuine concerns, our support team is always here to help through the proper channels. We wish you the best in your trading journey. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Honest review, avoid for your peace of mind.
reviews.content: Honest review of the prop firm after few months, few challenges and few funded accounts with them.The only good thing I can say about this prop firm is prices of their challanges. They are low. And here is where the good things end.Without going into ridiculous details, this prop firm is doing EVERYTHING they possibly can to avoid paying their traders, having numbers of hidden rules and making new ones on the go just to deny payout and terminate funded accounts even if you won’t breach any official rules. I have made over 20% of 50k account in a month and a half time. Got nothing out of that. All refused. They said they have no consistency rule - that’s a lie they have consistency score which is even worse, they said they have no risk per trade - another lie, if you risk more 2% on your trade they will fail your account and refuse a payout.And of course they will BAN you form discord chats when you start asking questions and you expose their actions. At the moment I’m facing 7 days ban for asking about payout denied. To get any answer or clarification you have to wait 3/4 days sometimes even more for one email or message. It’s not worth your money, your time, and your efforts to sing up with this company.Avoid at all costs.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We appreciate your feedback, though it’s important to correct several misleading claims to help the community understand the facts. First, we do not have a hidden consistency rule. Our platform offers flexibility in trading style, and traders are free to express their edge, as long as their risk remains responsible and within the clearly stated guidelines available in our Help Center. The “consistency score” mentioned is a tool, not a rule, and it does not disqualify payouts. We do not terminate funded accounts without cause. If an account is denied a payout, it is always based on violations of transparent and documented terms. Our goal is to support and scale serious traders, not to penalize success. Lastly, we only issue temporary Discord timeouts when community guidelines are violated, such as spreading false information, using aggressive language, or attempting to disrupt trader support. Everyone is welcome to ask questions and engage respectfully. We remain committed to fairness and transparency, and thousands of traders are actively funded and paid with us every week. We encourage anyone reading this to visit our Help Center, check our payouts channel, or speak with real traders in our community. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for sharing your feedback, although we’d like to clarify a few key points for the community. We do not increase costs after passing, this is a common misconception, and we encourage traders to review their trading conditions in detail at each stage. Secondly, our drawdown calculations are entirely automated and based on clearly defined metrics, which are transparently outlined in our Help Center. If your account breached due to drawdown, it would have aligned precisely with the agreed-upon risk parameters. We’ve found no technical issues with the systems calculating drawdown. Our platform is built on fairness, consistency, and transparency and thousands of traders succeed with us every day. reviews.content: I was scammed... In fact, my equity had only moved slightly below the starting point, staying well within all defined risk parameters.I had made about $500+ in profit today, and no open trades had unrealized losses exceeding acceptable limits.Given these figures, I kindly request a thorough review of the reason behind the restriction. If this was an error in the system or an internal flagging mechanism, I would appreciate it if you could reinstate my trading privileges or clarify what specific rule or data triggered the violation.I look forward to your prompt response and resolution.Warm regards,Offor EmekaAccount ID: 21807

reviews.title: If I could issue a zero I would
reviews.content: If I could issue a zero I would. I used them for the first time today and they closed my account down for "Failed due to Maximum Risk Limit Exceeded" to which I immedialy responded back to as I initially tried to close my trade down at a small loss at 14:00 and hour prior to the high impact news event. I was unable to do this as my MT5 was greyed out from making any changes. I was able to tighten my stops with The5ers and Traderscale which both worked fine within MT5. It was just this one. So I allowed the trade to run on at a 1% risk. The trade went on to reach my target and following this I immediately had an email advising the account was breached. When I tried to question this they tried to blame my broadband connection. Use them at your own risk. Lucky enough I used my CC and will be logging a claimback. Further update:My account didn't exceed the risk limit due to my SL which wasn't hit. This was confirmed by your advisor via email. His explanation was that it was due to slippage. However, was unable to explain why the SL wasn't hit which was within the risk parameters if it was slippage. The trade went on to profit and then you closed the account. I advised that I will be contacting my credit card provider and then was threatened by their advisor begging me not to do this because if I do. They will block me from their platform and all their affiliate partners. Stay well clear of of company. I have the full version of events via email and happy to publish them on here. Email response:Hi Kevin,Thanks for your follow-up.Your account breached the 1% max risk per trade rule on the Instant Funded program. Even if your SL was placed at 1%, the actual loss slightly exceeded the limit, and as per our policy, any amount over triggers an automatic failure.There was no system downtime at the time — the platform was fully operational.We appreciate your passion, but we kindly remind you that initiating a chargeback would constitute a breach of our Terms of Service and result in a permanent ban from our platform so please refrain from thatShould you wish to return in the future, we’d be happy to have you back with a fresh account and a tighter risk plan.Best regards,ObiwanFundingTradersQuestion: if this was due to slippage and I breached the risk parameters even knowing my SL was within the risk parameters the SL would have been hit. Given it wasn't hit means I didn't breach the risk parameters.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Kevin, We understand your frustration, but your description does not reflect the actual sequence of events as recorded on our system. Your account was closed due to a breach of the Maximum Risk Limit. This rule is in place to ensure fair and consistent trading conditions for all participants. Your claim about being unable to close the trade due to a platform issue was not supported by any system errors on our side. Our trading servers were fully operational during that time, and we had no downtime affecting executions or trade modifications. The issue you described appears to be isolated and unrelated to our platform, as confirmed by internal technical checks. Many traders across our platform operate MT5 without issue. While we cannot comment on other firms, we can confirm that risk violations on our side are strictly based on data and not decided manually or arbitrarily. We welcome traders who follow the rules and trade with discipline, and we are always available to clarify any policy before you begin trading. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. We appreciate your trust in us! FundingTraders Team

reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We’re sorry to hear about your frustration, but your description of events is not consistent with our records or policies. Your account experienced a hard breach of the daily loss limit, which, as clearly stated in the rules for our latest Instant Funding accounts, results in an automatic termination. This information is transparently available on our website and in our Help Center. The confusion seems to stem from a misunderstanding between older and newer account structures, something we have since clarified directly with you. At no point was there a system failure or error in risk management. Our system did exactly what it is programmed to do: protect capital when a predefined limit is exceeded. The claim that a potential profit was “missed” is based on hindsight, the platform does not assess trades based on what could have happened if rules were ignored. We did, however, offer you a retake at no additional cost as a gesture of goodwill, despite the breach being valid. We remain open to resolving this with you professionally, but we encourage all traders to take a moment to understand the clear guidelines in place before trading. We support disciplined traders who take time to review and follow the rules, and we continue to maintain transparency and fairness across all accounts. reviews.reply_content: Hey Adnan, We appreciate your feedback, but your description does not align with the account data we maintain for every trader. Our systems track all equity fluctuations in real-time, and accounts are only breached if the clearly defined daily loss limit is hit based on real-time equity drawdown, not just closed trades. In your case, be reminded that the daily loss limit for 1-step accounts is relative to starting day's equity. The equity was up so high that when the daily drawdown was reset, the daily limit went up above the balance, which caused the account to be marked as "Failed". We understand the frustration, but we encourage all traders to fully understand the rules before trading. Our goal is to support consistent and disciplined traders, and we remain transparent and fair in all evaluations. If you ever have questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to us at help@fundingtraders.com. We appreciate your trust in us! FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: My awful experience with funding traders
reviews.content: Stay away! They are scammers! I bought a challenge of 200k and successfully completed it, upon review they decided to halve my account saying that I am a high risk trader even though I followed all their rules, I got a payout of 500$ + a refund, on my second payout of 8k, they told me that my profit had more than 50% of news profit, so they asked me to place 10 trades of + or - 0.5%, during those trades, I had completed around 7 trades before they close the account again and once again they asked me to place another 10 trades, essentially they wanted me to overtrade and lose my profits, I completed those trades and increased my profits to 12k, upon review they accused me of news trading once again and a red GBP folder when I am trading gold, GBP news doesnt have a big impact on gold and usd pairs. So they decided to terminate my account and still had to pay me 50% of my profits, after 1 month of waiting they sent the payout, but they sent it to the wrong address, an address I have never seen before and they told me that it was the address I provided them, I tried to resolve this but they said it was my fault. I just decided to leave everything behind and forget about it since there was nothing I could do. Very bad prop firm, one of the worst.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Devon, Thanks for your feedback, though your version of events doesn’t reflect the facts. Your account was reviewed according to our clearly stated guidelines, and at no point were you asked to "overtrade" or violate any trading principles. The high-risk assessment was based on objective factors, not personal opinion, and the news trading violations were backed by data showing positions opened, closed, or held within restricted windows. As for the payout, our records confirm the wallet address matched the one provided on your payout request. We always recommend double-checking payout details to avoid issues, and we processed your payout despite rule breaches as a gesture of goodwill. If you need further assistance, don’t hesitate to reach out at help@fundingtraders.com. We’re always here to help! FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Stay Away from Funding Traders!!!
reviews.content: I would highly recommend anyone to stay far away from Funding Traders. After spending a few months to pass both phases of the challenge they disallowed my funded account, as they accused me of using a martingale strategy. I do not trade using a martingale strategy and anyone who actually would take a look at my trades could clearly see that. The issue was that there were a few trades where second positions were opened, which were opened inadvertently on the Trade Locker mobile app. There is an issue with the Trade Locker mobile app where the buy and sell buttons are at the right and left side at the bottom. If you are not careful your hand could accidently brush against one of these buttons which will open a trade. When this happened to me I would delete the second position as soon as I noticed it open. They viewed these few instances as me using a martingale strategy and disallowed my funded account. Once explaining to them how those second positions happened they wrote me back stating that the funded account is disallowed, and that they will not consider the possible reason for any inadvertent trades caused by a flaw in their app. Their communication with me was very brusk and they obviously were not interested in seeing what is an obvious problem. I believe that they look for any reason to disqualify anyone who may pass their challenges. If for some reason Funding Traders decided to respond to this review keep in mind that in my communication with them, they were only interested in disqualifying me and had no intention in discussing what is an obvious problem with Trade Locker mobile app. Trading is hard enough without you in the end getting disqualified for a slip of a finger or a problem with an app. Do you really want to invest your money and time into this prop firm only to have to deal with a risk management team that has no interest in talking with you and instead send brusk emails. Obviously they could handle their communications with their customers much better, but I think they could really care less.In response to Funding Traders: Funding Traders are obviously just sending a canned message and avoiding the issue I mentioned in the original review. I do not use martingale strategy in any of my trades, it is not a trading strategy that I use. I would accept Funding Traders explanation if in fact I were actually trading using a martingale strategy. I explained the reason an additional position opened up on the one trade of hundreds they are making an issue about. It is a problem with the TradeLocker mobile app. The buy and sell buttons are too close to the bottom of the screen where many people hold their phones. In my case that additional position was opened when my hand unintentionally brushed against the buy/sell button and it opened the second position. Funding Traders besides inadequately responding to my review and address the actual issue, they obviously were in a hurry to send out any kind of a response in a weak effort to defend themselves, showing how little they care for their customers.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Erick, Thank you for sharing your experience. We would like to clarify that our risk management rules, including the Martingale policy, are clearly communicated and consistently enforced to maintain fairness and protect both traders and our capital. Our team carefully reviews all cases with transparency and fairness, and decisions are made based on objective trade data rather than assumptions. Communication from our support and risk teams is professional and aimed at providing clear explanations. We encourage traders to reach out directly if they have concerns, as we are committed to resolving issues respectfully and thoroughly. If you ever need further help, don’t hesitate to reach out at help@fundingtraders.com. Best regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.content: I am extremely disappointed as I have encountered so many problems. - First one being:Having a running position and suddenly, you cannot close the trade. Bad market conditions and excessive spreads even though when you purchase the account, they tell you low spreads. This is very disappointing. I had a winning position, mind you the position never got near the SL, I get into meta trader, and the positon was closed at 50 pips above my entry price. That's ridiculousI reach out to support and it's the same thing about their liquidity provider. How is anyone supposed to pass their evaluations in such conditions ? You don't even know if you can trust them with your trades

Regarding closed positions, every trade is logged and reviewed in line with the platform’s real-time data and execution reports. We remain fully committed to offering a professional and transparent trading environment for all users. If you or anyone else needs help, just reach out anytime at help@fundingtraders.com. reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money with…
reviews.content: Don't waste your time or money with this fraud of a company. They look for ways to ensure you fail. I passed 4 25K accounts phase 1 & 2. I was then accused of trade copying, which was a lie. All the accounts had the same positions that I manually put on. They were JPY pair swing shorts that I held for weeks. The 4th account had moved away a bit before I could put the positions on so since the entry prices were a bit different, they accused me of news trading to fail that account. Absolutely ridiculous, but I guess they felt bad for this level of corruption so they actually refunded me on that account. When these prop firms began, you had 5% daily drawdown and 10% total. Now every rule in the book is created to breach traders. In my case I didn't breach anything, but they saw a trader that could trade and realized they didn't want to deal with having to pay out a successful trader. Take heed of all these negative reviews and save your money. Also, no need in trying to dispute anything, they won't respond. This firm will be out of business soon.Account numbers that they screwed me on: 8561, 8563, 8560, 8568If you are foolish enough to buy a challenge, make sure you claw back your money from your credit card company when they screw you. Trust me, they will!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Jason, Thank you for your feedback. We take every claim seriously and want to clarify that all trading activities are thoroughly reviewed with transparent and consistent criteria. Accusations such as trade copying or news trading are only made after careful investigation supported by detailed trade analysis. Our policies, including drawdown limits and risk management rules, are designed to protect both traders and the firm, ensuring a fair and sustainable trading environment. Discounts and promotions are offered openly to help traders access our programs, not to mislead or exploit. We maintain open communication channels and strive to respond promptly to all inquiries and disputes. Our commitment is to support our traders and uphold the highest standards of integrity in the industry. If you ever need further help, don’t hesitate to reach out at help@fundingtraders.com. Best regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Scam,Fraud Scammers
reviews.content: 1. I purchased a $10,000 step account for $62.50 and successfully passed both Step 1 and Step 2 evaluations. I was then moved to a real funded account on MT5, where I actively traded.2. Through disciplined and consistent trading, I earned a profit of $19,991, bringing the account balance to $29,991. When I requested a withdrawal, the company asked me to sign up for a Rise WorkPay account for payouts. I complied, but the KYC/KYB process on Rise's side caused significant delays that were completely out of my control. No alternative withdrawal methods were offered.3. On April 5, I received an email stating that my account was “failed” due to 21 days of inactivity—despite the fact that:This rule was never disclosed to me when I signed up or during my trading.I received no email notification or warning before this sudden termination.My profits were made well before March 14, long before the alleged inactivity period.4. I requested either reinstatement of my account or a payout of my share (80% = $15,200). Both were denied. They refused to return my profits or even give access to my account again.In short: I did everything right, earned nearly $20,000 through honest trading, and they shut me down without warning, using a hidden rule and delay from their payment processor as an excuse. I did not receive a single dollar of my profit.How Can I Get Money from this prop firm"Funding Traders"?
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for sharing your concerns. However, we must clarify that this review does not accurately reflect the sequence of events or the policies in place. The inactivity policy has been clearly stated in our Terms of Service and Help Center, and applies universally to all funded accounts to ensure platform integrity and active risk monitoring. Your account exceeded the maximum allowed days without trading activity, which automatically triggered account closure per policy. Regarding the payout, be reminded that your account is a challenge account. We don't offer payouts for challenge accounts. We always strive to support our traders, but must also maintain the standards and safeguards that ensure a fair environment for everyone. If you need anything else, feel free to reach out to us anytime at help@fundingtraders.com. Kind Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Passed the challenge
reviews.content: Passed the challenge – all three $100K accounts failed at once due to Martingale rule under strictest conditionsI took the $100K 1-step challenge with Funded Traders and successfully passed three separate accounts. Without warning, all three were failed at once, with the explanation that I violated the Martingale rule.I did not use a classic Martingale strategy. My position sizing was based on risk management and market structure — not doubling down on losses. I met all profit and drawdown criteria, and still, my progress was instantly denied across all accounts.This happened under the 1-step challenge, which is already known for having much stricter rules and tighter limits than standard programs. And to make things worse, Funded Traders later removed the Martingale rule entirely for new (NextGen) accounts — but gave no option for Legacy users like me to transition, appeal, or receive a fair review.When I contacted support to explain the situation, the responses I received were cold, robotic, and completely unhelpful — as if the staff were forced to be there. No empathy, no willingness to reconsider, no flexibility.This isn't just a complaint — I have full records and proof of everything. I'm prepared to show detailed evidence of my trades and compliance with the rules, because claims like this are serious, and they deserve transparency.Conclusion: I cannot recommend Funded Traders to any serious trader.They apply outdated rules inconsistently, fail multiple accounts without proper justification, and offer zero support when questioned. A truly disappointing experience.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Thank you for your feedback. While we understand your frustration, we must respectfully clarify that your accounts were reviewed thoroughly and action was taken in full accordance with the rules you agreed to upon registration. The Martingale-like trading pattern observed was not based on assumptions, but on objective risk behavior across your positions that posed a clear violation of our risk protocols. The rule was not applied retroactively, and your trades were not disqualified without cause. Although our programs evolve over time, all participants are held to the terms active at the time of their challenge. We remain committed to fair, transparent, and consistent evaluation of all accounts and encourage traders to always review the rules in detail to avoid misunderstandings. If you need anything else, feel free to reach out to us anytime at help@fundingtraders.com. Kind Regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: Company confirmed my $20,909 payout, 10days later reversed it with false excuses
reviews.content: I am writing this updated review after reading the company’s reply to my previous post regarding my unpaid confirmed payout from Funding Traders. I strongly deny their claims, and I kindly ask Trustpilot to only publish this message after verifying my evidence, which I am ready to submit in full. Since attachments are not allowed here, I ask readers to note: this message reflects facts supported by documented proof, and the review is only public because Trustpilot confirmed the credibility of my claims.📍1. About the 12-Day Silence and CommunicationI strongly dispute the company’s claim of professional and timely communication. Over the 12 days following the confirmed payout, they responded only a few times. I have screenshots of all emails and timestamps, clearly showing days of silence and vague responses like “please wait.” On May 6, I suddenly received a message that my payout receipt was incorrect — 10 days after it had been officially issued.📍2. Retroactive Rule Change and $5,000 DeductionOriginally, the company tried to deny my payout completely due to a new rule introduced a week after I had already started trading in the funded account (not evaluation). Later, they changed their stance and offered only 30% of my profits. I pushed back by sending a screenshot of their rules from the date I joined, and they then admitted that I was right. After this, we agreed that $5,000 would be deducted, and the remaining $20,616.38 would be paid.The difference between their original offer (30%) and our final agreement (80%) proves they accepted that the rule was indeed new. I have full email documentation of this.📍3. EA Accusation After Confirmed PayoutThe most serious issue: on April 25, my payout was confirmed in writing. But on May 6 — after more than a week of no payment — I received a message accusing me of using an Expert Advisor (EA). I strongly deny this. I do not use EAs, I don't even know how. All trades were placed manually. The accusation was made after the confirmed payout, without any detailed explanation or evidence.How can a firm issue a finalized payout receipt, promise payment “within 24 hours,” and then cancel it 12 days later with a vague accusation? What’s the point of formal confirmation if it can be revoked at will?📍4. Being Silenced and BlockedTheir CEO personally removed me from their Telegram group after I politely asked about my pending payment. I have screenshots showing my message and the moment I was removed. I was then blocked by the CEO on Telegram and have since never received a response to my emails to him — not even once.📍5. Final StatementI completely reject the company's claims made in their public response. I am a serious trader who worked hard for this profit, not a novice gambler. I have no reason to lie. I have provided Trustpilot with full supporting evidence to verify everything in this review.I ask the Trustpilot team to continue to hold this company accountable, and I warn other traders: do not trust payout confirmations unless you actually receive the money. My experience shows how this firm failed to honor their own promises and responded with false excuses when I demanded what I was owed.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Hedieh, Thank you for your updated review. We categorically deny the claims made and would like to reaffirm that all of our actions were in full compliance with our publicly disclosed terms and conditions. The payout in question was placed under internal review due to flagged trading activity that met specific risk parameters associated with automated behavior. Contrary to your statements, no payout was ever officially finalized or guaranteed; all payouts are subject to compliance checks, as it is the standard across the industry. Removal from our channels occurred only after repeated violations of our community guidelines. We remain committed to fairness, transparency, and protecting the integrity of our trading environment. If you have any questions or need assistance, please send us an email at help@fundingtraders.com Best regards, FundingTraders Team

reviews.title: A Prop Firm that Cares
reviews.content: To be quick and brief, this company goes an extra mile to understand their aspiring traders. I have violated the maximum loss per trade idea regulation and my trading activity was suspended, currently during the challenge phase. The problem started when I mis-interpreted the specifics of the regulation as worded on their website, regulations section. I understood one thing and acted on it as it is written, while it meant something different and I advised that the wording of the regulation could be changed so that it is crystal clear.I explained my point of view to the risk management department and they explained theirs. We had a good speedy conversation. At the end, as a sign of goodwill, they reinstated my purchased challenge account and wished me luck. If more companies acted this way, the world will be a better place. Their brand image just rose a thousand fold in my eyes.I will be updating this review regularly once I become a funded trader.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Adnan, Thank you for sharing your thoughtful experience. We truly appreciate your openness and are glad to hear that the team took the time to understand your situation and respond with clarity and fairness. It's our goal to support traders while maintaining transparency, and feedback like yours helps us improve continuously. We're rooting for you on your journey to becoming a funded trader, best of luck, and we’ll be here to cheer you on every step of the way!

reviews.title: DOESN'T PAY EVEN IF YOU HAVE FOLLOWED ALL THE RULES
reviews.content: My experience with FundingTraders was extremely bad, stay away from this prop firm. They are stealing your money.From the start, there was a lack of transparency in their operations. The rules seemed to shift without notice, evaluation criteria were vague and inconsistently applied, and their customer support doesn't exist and it takes days to have an answer that doesn't solve any problem. Than another 4/5 days after that to receive another answer that doesn't solve the problem. The real issues began when I reached the funded account. At first I passed a 200k phase but they just gave me a 100k phase. And they told me to accept the 100k funded or the only alternative was to be refunded. If I wanted the 200k I should have reached a 10% profit (spoiler: even if I then reached the 10% profit they have never given me the 200k account) I was able to make a 3.5% payout on the 100k account with a 1% risk per trade. And they denied me the payout for news trading (they changed the news trading rule the day before without warning any trader, and I didn't notice that). So they told me that the news trading profit couldn't be more of the 50% of the total payout. So I continued trading and reached a profit of the 7.5% on the account. So now the news trading profits were less of the 50% of the requested payout. And now as you can imagine, they denied my payout telling me I traded during a news. When in the hours I made the trades there were no medium or high impact news (yes because they consider also medium impact news and not only high impact ones). So tried to reach the support and after waiting for 3 weeks for a check of my trades, and after I gave them all the proves needed that attested that I didn't open/closed trades ot tp/sl hitted during the window time stated on their rules, they just confirmed the denial of the payout without any reason or evidence to support their point of view.So I was faced with unjustified accusations of rule violations, suspicious account terminations, and a clear unwillingness to cooperate or provide fair treatment. I then understood they were doing everything possible to avoid paying.I’ve worked with other prop firms and know what to expect from a legitimate and professional company. FundingTraders is not one of them.Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. There are far better and more trustworthy options available. PS: A lot of their reviews are fake, in trustpilot but also on sites like propfirmmatch. And unfortunately even those who work inside know that they don't pay. And if you try to ask for help on discord exposing the firm. They will ban you immediately. Trying to cover it all up.  Solid firms don't offer 50% discount on mostly every month.Avoid them. I have warned you.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Giammarco, We appreciate your feedback, but we must respectfully clarify several inaccuracies presented in your statement. FundingTraders maintains a transparent and structured framework for all traders, with rules and terms clearly outlined and accessible prior to account purchase. These rules are not arbitrarily changed or applied inconsistently, and all updates are communicated through official channels. Your funded account was issued in alignment with the criteria met during your evaluation, and the option to upgrade or receive a refund was provided as a gesture of flexibility. Regarding the payout process, we uphold strict compliance with our risk management guidelines, including rules around news trading. These policies exist to ensure fair trading conditions across the board and are not subject to sudden or unnotified changes. The review process of your trades was conducted thoroughly and in line with our standards. The denial of your payout was not arbitrary, but based on verifiable breaches of the outlined rules. We regret that the outcome did not align with your expectations, but we are committed to fairness and consistency in all trader evaluations. Any implication that our reviews are fabricated or that support is deliberately unhelpful is categorically false. We have a dedicated team that actively addresses all inquiries, and disciplinary actions on community platforms are only taken when terms of service or community guidelines are violated. We stand by our integrity, and while not every trader may agree with every outcome, our goal remains to provide a reliable and performance-based opportunity for serious traders.

reviews.title: Next Gen Account Broken
reviews.content: I want to share my negative experience with them, specifically with their Next Gen Funded account program. On the surface, their offer seems appealing, but in practice, the rules they aplied are poorly designed and very unfairly enforced. In my case, I had a $25,000 Next Gen account, i had a bad trading day and lost $1,400. The next day, I was able to recover the loss and made a $200 in profit. However, they say that my consistency score is 247% because of the day in wich I recovered everything and made only 200 in profits now the balance being $25,200.So, the issue is this, they calculate the consistency score based on your gross profits for the day, regardless of whether that profit is simply recovering prior losses or actual net gains beyond break-even. This logic is unfair, because you can only withdraw if you're beyound brake-even in my case $25,000.Instead of rewarding solid, disciplined recovery, they punish you for recovering your loses, even if that day only brings you back to where you started in breke-even, in my case 25k.From my point of view, the consistency rule should only apply to real net profits.What i mean is, gains that are made to recover previous losses should NOT penalize a trader in the consistency score basis, for recovering from a losing day. IS NOT REASONALBE TO DO SO.For me they didn't provide a fair or transparent environment for trader in their Next Gen, because they didn't tell you that this works like that, for all of the traders it's common sense that only the profits of the account count for the consistency score. Poorly designed next gen rules, and appling rules like this only shows the lack of compsasion for traders that this busnes has.I'm willing to remove this bad review if they change the consistency rule.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Eric, Thank you for sharing your feedback. However, your interpretation of the consistency rule within the Next Gen Funded program does not align with how the rule is defined or communicated. The consistency score is transparently calculated based on daily gross profits to ensure that traders demonstrate controlled and repeatable performance over time, not one-off recoveries that expose accounts to excessive intra-day volatility. The purpose of this rule is not to penalize traders for recovering losses, but rather to reward stable and strategic trading. Every trader agrees to these terms before beginning the program, and they are available for review at any time on our platform. Recovery after a drawdown that results in an unusually high gross profit in a single day, even if it brings the account slightly above breakeven, can indicate inconsistent risk management. We value all trader experiences, but the framework exists to ensure long-term sustainability for both the trader and the firm. Adjusting rules based on individual outcomes would compromise the integrity of the evaluation. Nonetheless, we always welcome constructive input, and we continually review all program features to support fair and professional trading environments.

reviews.content: Worst experience of my life. My payout withdrawal was requested on 2/17. And it was extended to 3/11 as I need to achieve news trading ratio in order to request again. reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We understand your frustration, but your claims are not accurate. At FundingTraders, we have a transparent and structured payout process that thousands of traders successfully complete each month. Your payout was never “stalled” arbitrarily; rather, it was subject to clearly stated requirements, including adherence to trading guidelines like news risk ratio and minimum lot requirements, standards that apply equally to all traders, without exception. Once all conditions are met and properly verified, payouts are processed accordingly. Any delays you experienced were due to unmet requirements on your end, not any intention to withhold funds. Our support and escalation teams continuously assist traders through the process, and we do not selectively choose which payouts to process. Assertions of schemes or favoritism are simply false.

reviews.title: Disappointing Experience
reviews.content: Disappointing Experience – Would Not RecommendAt first, everything seems great — they draw you in with tight spreads and attractive offers during the challenge phase. But after passing both challenges, they switch your broker to Preferred Capital, where spreads become outrageous. Pairs like EUR/USD and GBP/USD regularly show spreads between 16–20. They blame “market conditions,” but the spreads remain just as bad even on quiet, no-news days.I also noticed in their Discord payout section that most of the payouts are for small accounts. Larger accounts appear to face significant delays, which raises more concerns.Overall, I strongly recommend staying away. Propfirms like FTMO offer a much more transparent and reliable experience.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We are sorry to hear that you had a negative experience, but the claims you've made are simply not accurate. We take great care to ensure our traders receive the best possible trading conditions, including competitive spreads, regardless of the broker. Any minor fluctuation in spreads due to market conditions is always addressed properly. Regarding payouts, our system is designed to process all withdrawals in a timely manner. Larger accounts do not face delays beyond the standard verification and compliance checks required for all payouts. These checks are implemented to protect both the trader and the firm, ensuring everything is handled properly. We are committed to transparency and fairness and encourage you to reach out to our support team for assistance. Thousands of satisfied traders continue to experience success with FundingTraders, and we are confident that you will too once we resolve any misunderstandings.

reviews.title: Shady and unethical firm
reviews.content: Shady, unethical company with rules like 21 day inactivity where almost all others are 30 days. No warning or any heads up that account will breach. Support as useful as a sack of bricks...The reason this company does this is just to extract funds from people who might make a honest mistake of not trading for 3 weeks (in my case I was trading in another account). Will such a company honor any payout? In all probability such firms that knowingly keep rules (that are not the industry standard) and which provides them no net benefit (does it make a difference if you trade every 30 days or 21 days on a demo account) but can help them get the funds of a few unlucky people are scams. Please avoid this firm and inform everyone you know they are not to be trusted. No flexibility or understanding or common decency with their support staff who are badly programmed robots.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We are sorry to hear that you feel this way, but we would like to clarify that FundingTraders is fully committed to transparency, fairness, and ensuring the best experience for our traders. Our inactivity rule is in place to maintain the integrity of trading activity, and it is clearly outlined in our terms and conditions to prevent misunderstandings. Unlike other firms, we ensure that all rules are communicated upfront, with no hidden fees or sudden changes that would negatively affect our traders. Regarding our support, we pride ourselves on providing responsive and helpful assistance. Our team works diligently to address all concerns, and we encourage open communication with our traders to resolve any issues promptly. We understand the frustration of not meeting specific criteria, but our policies are in place to maintain fairness and ensure the continued success of our trading community. We value every trader's experience and are committed to helping you reach your goals.

reviews.title: So as a funded trader with 200k in…
reviews.content: So as a funded trader with 200k in capital they do pay. I am giving this firm two stars because paying is the bare minimum a firm should do. They have increasing strict rules that no firm has. Now they have a newly implemented news rule. That states if the trade isn’t opened 5 hours before news and closed 5 min before you earn no profits. This can be an issue when funded as if your drawdown was higher than news profits it’s a breach. Secondly the spread on this firm is horrendous. I’m looking at 300+ spread on NZDJPY when all my other accounts on other firms are fine. It should not be a headache to trade with a firm this is ridiculous.

reviews.title: Suspicious practices
reviews.content: Received a downsized account after passing 4 phases for 1 100k account. I wasn’t in violation of any actual rule so Beware they will make up rules as they go to downsize you.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Jacquelyn, Your claim that we “make up rules” to downsize accounts is categorically false. Our processes are structured, transparent, and governed by a set of risk management principles that are clearly outlined from the start. No trader is ever downsized arbitrarily or without cause. All funded accounts are subject to ongoing evaluation to ensure long-term consistency and risk-aligned trading. In rare cases where account parameters raise significant internal flags, such as inconsistent lot sizing, abnormal exposure patterns, or unsustainable risk behaviors, a temporary adjustment may be made to preserve account longevity. This is not about inventing rules; it’s about upholding the integrity of the program and ensuring all traders meet the same standards. We remain committed to treating every trader fairly and transparently and welcome constructive dialogue from those who wish to understand the reasoning behind account-level decisions.

reviews.title: Unfair Termination, False Claims, and Excuses to Avoid Payouts
reviews.content: Unfair Termination, False Claims, and Excuses to Avoid PayoutsI was funded by Funding Traders after successfully completing their evaluation. However, they abruptly terminated my funded account without issuing the payout I had earned, citing a supposed “consistency rule” about trading correlated pairs.They falsely claimed I had been warned previously — a complete lie. No warning was ever given, and the trades they questioned all occurred before their first email. Worse, some members of their own team even acknowledged that, according to their own FAQ, none of my trades actually violated any rules. The idea of "correlated pair trading" as a violation seems to be a made-up excuse to deny payouts.I never tried to bypass any rule — I traded based on market setups. The pairs in question (e.g., EURUSD + GBPUSD, USDCAD + USDCHF, CADJPY + EURJPY) are standard, and treating them as violations is absurd. There was no transparency, no real warning, and no fair chance to adjust my strategy — just sudden termination.This looks like a pattern designed to eliminate profitable traders before they cost the firm money. They present themselves as a prop trading firm but behave more like a money trap.Proceed with caution. I would not recommend Funding Traders to anyone serious about trading.--------------------------------Reply to FundingTrader response:Thank you for your response, but I must clarify that your version of events is misleading.No prior warning was ever given about any "correlated trading violations." The trades you flagged were placed before your first email, and there was no opportunity given to adjust my strategy.The pairs I traded — EURUSD+GBPUSD, USDCAD+USDCHF, CADJPY+EURJPY+EURCHF — are widely used and do not violate any published rules. Multiple members of your own team acknowledged in writing that none of these pairs are considered explicitly correlated in your FAQ.You’ve falsely claimed that you warned me in advance, which is simply not true. This undermines your claim of transparency and fairness.It’s clear that these rules are applied selectively and retroactively, and the entire process seems more like a tactic to avoid payouts than a genuine risk concern. I passed your evaluation fair and square, only to have my funded account terminated on vague, unpublished, and inconsistent grounds.This experience makes it clear that FundingTraders is not operating in good faith with traders.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Chandana, We appreciate your feedback, though the version of events you've described does not align with the facts reviewed by our risk and compliance team. Your account was thoroughly evaluated, and the decision to terminate funding was based on repeated violations of correlated trading behavior, which is explicitly outlined in our risk guidelines. The pairs you mentioned, while common, were traded in highly correlated patterns with identical timing and sizing, triggering a clear flag under our internal risk replication criteria. Our consistency protocols are not arbitrary; they are in place to ensure real-world viability of trading strategies for capital deployment. Our goal is to support long-term, sustainable traders, not to penalize profitable ones arbitrarily. We understand these situations can be frustrating, especially after effort has been put into passing evaluations. However, all actions were taken with full transparency and in accordance with our published terms.

reviews.title: Risk Team Is Full of Arrogance.
reviews.content: Listen to my story and you can i decide was the decision right or wrongi had an account of 50k with them account number "10157" their risk team breached my account during manual checking reason they had given me for the breach is that i have taken a risk 2.10% and violated there rule of 2 percent risk per trade i said to them that if it is a hard breach and i already had breached my account in phase 1 than why had you provided me with phase 2i quoted from there rules that if breach of 2% per trade rules is detected system will automatically closed the trade and account will be flagged as failed i inquired about this that why have you wasted my time and energy of 2 months as i have taken 49 trades 48 of them are correct  and i do not even remember that trade as which they mentioned in manual review i do not know if they had themselves put a trade in the history and breached my accountbecause if that trade existed already they should have breached my account in phase 1and another thing about their risk team they will never listen to what you are saying and they will do whatever they like as they did in my case and can snatch your funded account without giving you any explanation.See there response shows that they do not care about the traders time energy and effort they will just find an excuse to breach your account.rest depends on you if you want to waste your time and energy than come and join this firm otherwise there are far better option in the industry.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Syed, Thank you for sharing your experience. However, your interpretation of the events does not accurately reflect how our systems and risk protocols operate. The 2% per-trade risk guideline is not only clearly outlined but actively monitored throughout the evaluation process. Your account was not flagged earlier because the breach in question did not trigger the automated system but was identified during the manual review, which is a standard part of our multi-layered verification process prior to funding. The trade you are referring to was not fabricated, trade logs are recorded automatically and cannot be manipulated. Our team followed the protocol, and the decision was made after a thorough review of your trading history. While we understand your frustration, our goal is to uphold a consistent standard of trading behavior that reflects real-world risk management, which this instance did not meet.

reviews.title: Stay away from this firm. They will NOT pay you out. (Updated)
reviews.content: I had 4 challenges with this firm. Passed two and failed two. However with one of those evaluations I had requested a payout of over 5k. I followed every single rule with a next gen account. I had a consistency score of 21%, 7 VWHT, and no news trading. However the risk management team admitting that I didn’t break any rules made up their own rules when I requested a payout. Even though their margintale rules don’t apply which is don’t risk over 2% per trade, these guys ended up flagging one trade that I risked more than 1.5% but less than 2% per trade. For that they ended up denying my payout and told me that they would give me a free funded retake or to get a refund for the account. They unjustly rejected my payout instead of sticking to their rules so I’d advise everyone to not waste their time on this firm. They have a good support team via online for mangiusum, Khalifa and Kid, however the risk management team is full of shit and are unfair. Update:5/6/2025 - So I decided to take them up on their offer from risk management to have a funded retake. This time I not only had to follow the FAQ rules (which i followed the first time but still had first payout denied but no problem, i did it once, i can do it again without an issue) but I also have to follow a few new ones that they made specifically for me to follow which were understandable and doable as well. I documented each and every trade individually showing how much I risked and the time it took to close the trade as well. Requested my payout yesterday so I should find out if they'll really pay out or not by tomorrow night since it says it takes up to 48 hours on average to get your payout approved. Will update again when I get a response on here.Update #2: So far its been over 48 hours and about my third day since i requested payout, nothing from Funded Traders. Online support said that my payout was reviewed and to be patient. Update #3: Requested payout on Monday night, its end of the week Friday evening and I just received the contract for rise. Still no payout so we just have to be patient and give them until next week. Next week I should also be able to request a payout. If both are given i might reconsider my review.Update #4: My second payout was approved! The first one was denied but my second was approved after 7-8 days (5-6 business days) via rise as my payment option. I will be doing one last update within a month to see if my third payout request will be approved. If it does then in that case we're going to have to change our review and give it a 4-5 stars afterall. Overall again their customer service including KID, OBIWAN, KHALIFA, and magnisum are awesome as they reply back fast and always helpful in answering your questions as well as directly moving your issues to the rightful department!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We appreciate your detailed feedback, but the situation you’ve described does not align with the facts on record. Your account was thoroughly reviewed by our Risk Management Team, and at no point were rules created or changed after the fact. Our policies, including risk thresholds, are clearly outlined and apply consistently to all traders. The evaluation of your payout was based on established criteria that ensure long-term sustainability and fairness across the board. While we understand your frustration, we offered a retake or refund as a gesture of goodwill, even though the trading behavior in question did not meet the standards expected for live funding.
