reviews.title: FundingTraders.com Review
reviews.content: FundingTraders.com Review – Disappointing ExperienceI’ve been trading with FundingTraders.com, and honestly, I’m really disappointed—especially with their new rules. The most frustrating one is the 21-day inactivity rule. Basically, if you don’t trade for 21 days, your account is gone. That means no vacations, no time off for emergencies, or even just taking a break. It’s completely unreasonable and puts unnecessary pressure on traders.On top of that, there are other restrictive rules that make trading with them harder than it needs to be. It feels like the whole system is designed to trip you up rather than help you succeed.To be fair, their support team is responsive, and they do reply quickly, which is a plus. But unfortunately, the support can’t do much when these rigid rules are baked into the platform.Bottom line: I don’t recommend FundingTraders.com. There are better prop firms out there with more trader-friendly policies. Save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Peter, Thank you for sharing your thoughts. While we respect your opinion, we would like to clarify a few key points to avoid any confusion for others reading this. The 21-day activity requirement is not a new or hidden rule, it is standard practice among reputable firms to ensure that accounts remain active and reflective of a trader’s ongoing performance. This rule is in place to promote consistency and discipline, traits we believe are essential for long-term trading success. It by no means prevents traders from taking breaks, many of our users manage their schedules while remaining compliant simply by planning their trades accordingly. As for the claim of “restrictive rules,” our guidelines are designed to create a level playing field and prevent reckless behavior that can harm both the trader and the firm. Many of our traders thrive within this structure and appreciate the transparency we offer from day one. We appreciate your acknowledgment of our responsive support team. While they do operate within our policy framework, they always strive to provide clarity, solutions, and guidance. We remain committed to supporting serious traders with a fair, transparent, and professional environment.

reviews.title: I passed a $200,000 step one challenge…
reviews.content: I passed a $200,000 step one challenge and couldn’t funded for using “martingale”strategy, even though I didn’t use that strategy, I didn’t stop there I also passed a 100k Step one challenge in the same week and got told I used martingale like strategy even though I didn’t. these pop firms will claim that they are looking for talented traders But when a trader like, Me who has pinpoint accuracy and passes two challenges in the same week like clockwork that terrifies them because they don’t know whether they want to copy my trades or not once I’m funded.Traders like me who are bit aggressive like me are considered really risky for these prop firms because it’s hard decision for them to copy and execute my trades once funded.If they decide not to copy my trades until they see consistency and i make a large increase in account balance quickly they loose money because they didn’t copy my trades that’s it if they make an excuse to payout which this fraudulent company will most likely do.What I explained in this Review is the Dark manipulative Thought process Of every prop firm and this company is one of them making every excuse not to fund or pay traders even though they market them selves as this “quick cash grab come trade our capital” delusion.Please do extensive research when choosing prop firms, I’ve chosen prop firms where I get funded grow my accounts 20-30% and wait 30 days for payout and get denied, the prop firm industry is a Dark manipulative world be careful and trust the bigger companies don’t be fooled by other prop firms whose challenges are cheaper than others because most likely they are fraudulent…They responded to this dispute and I’ve got over 800 people who viewed my comment and I hit them where it hurts they should change company name from fundingtraders to fundingmaybe? Light will be shed upon of all of these fraudulent “prop firms” mark my words!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Mickey, Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate all perspectives and understand your frustration; however, we must respectfully correct several inaccuracies in your statement. Our evaluation process is strictly rule-based, and all accounts are assessed using identical criteria to ensure fairness and consistency. At no point did we disqualify your accounts arbitrarily or out of hesitation to fund you. The strategies observed during both your challenges displayed distinct patterns consistent with high-risk martingale-style trading, which is clearly outlined as a restricted practice in our terms and conditions. This evaluation was conducted by multiple members of our risk team to avoid any bias or misjudgment. Contrary to your suggestion, we do not fear funding skilled traders, in fact, we celebrate them. Many of our top performers trade aggressively while still adhering to risk parameters and transparency. The implication that we manipulate results or avoid payouts is simply false. Our business thrives on successful traders who are consistent, disciplined, and compliant with our guidelines. We understand that not being approved can be disappointing, but our goal remains to fund long-term, sustainable traders, not just those who pass a challenge. We remain committed to transparency and fairness and encourage all traders to review and understand our rules before participating.

reviews.title: Complaint Regarding Martingale Rules…
reviews.content: Complaint Regarding Martingale Rules After Challenge CompletionI hope this message finds you well.I am writing to express my concern and disappointment regarding the enforcement of your martingale-related rules after I successfully passed the challenge phase. During the evaluation, I complied with all stated rules and conditions. At no point during the challenge was I clearly informed that the use of a martingale-based strategy—even if applied with controlled risk—would result in disqualification or denial of a funded account after passing.If such a rule exists, it should be transparently and explicitly stated in the challenge terms and conditions, not enforced retroactively. It is both discouraging and frustrating to complete the challenge successfully, only to be denied the account based on vague or undisclosed criteria.I kindly request a formal review of my account and strategy, and a detailed explanation of how my trading violated specific rules. Furthermore, I urge you to consider the importance of transparency and fairness for your traders, especially those who trust your platform enough to participate in evaluations.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Nadif, Thank you for reaching out and for taking the time to express your concerns. We’d like to clarify that our evaluation process is fully transparent and that all trading strategies, including risk models such as martingale, are reviewed under strict internal compliance, criteria that are clearly outlined in our risk disclosures and trader guidelines available prior to the start of any challenge. We take pride in providing all necessary information up front so traders can make informed decisions. Your account was reviewed thoroughly upon completion of the challenge, and the denial of the funded account was not arbitrary. The trading history exhibited characteristics of a high-risk compounding strategy that does not align with our long-term funding objectives. While you may not have identified the method as martingale, the pattern of progressively increased position sizing following losses, regardless of the risk cap, matches the risk model we do not permit. These standards are essential for us to maintain a consistent, sustainable funding model that protects the firm and its traders. This policy is not enforced retroactively; rather, it is part of our standard review to ensure that strategies used during the challenge can be reliably applied in live trading conditions, where capital and risk are real. We value your effort and commitment, and we respect the time you invested. While we understand your disappointment, the decision made by our risk team was aligned with our terms. We remain fully committed to fairness, and we encourage you to review our strategy policies in more detail should you wish to attempt another evaluation in the future.

reviews.title: Prop firm that doesnt deliver on what…
reviews.content: Prop firm that doesnt deliver on what they claim to be. (They removed my first review)I was waiting to get my refund until i posted my honest and disappointing review. I would stay away from this firm. I spent 2 months on a 50k challenge passing it very consistently! Didnt even risk more than $300 dollars on any open position in which some were closed early avoiding losses but they saw it as “taking small scalps” which is ridiculous. I did not break any rules what so ever but when they “reviewed” my account they came at me with the lame excuse not to give me my funded account after working so hard for it for 2 months on both phases! saying i was “over leveregared” and “took too many scalps”. I dont even scalp. I day trade and swing. The many open and closed positions that had small profit or a very small loss im talking less than $20 dollars were break even trades but they pretended they did not see that and instead used it as an excuse to say they were “short scalps” even tho i did not break any RULES AT ALL. They gave me a refund but that is not the point. We as traders well atleast the profitable traders work so hard and take time to pass a challenge to get a funded account but instead end up doing THIS. I literally wasted 2 solid months only to be given a lame excuse why they werent going to give me my 50k funded account. “Risk management” said in their words that my strategy was unable to be replicated in a “real world environment” since they “copy our trades into a master account”. I trade legit higher timeframe supply and demand zones.   From a financial point, it wouldnt even make sense to copy trades into a real master account and also not even mentioning how on how long it takes to recieve a payout and thats even if you get lucky and dont get your payout denied! Also if you notice, they have 4.4 ratings but the reviews are only because the support members ask you to write a review and its just about them having “good customer service” thats debatable as well. *****Whether you believe me or not im not gonna sit here and argue with funding traders. I just dont recommend this prop firm period. This is a place for reviews from the consumers so here is my review.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Adrian, Thank you for your feedback, but we must clarify that your claims do not accurately represent our practices or policies. Our evaluation process is transparent and consistent across all traders. Your account underwent a thorough review by our Risk Management team, and the decision was based solely on objective trading data. The review identified a pattern of extremely low-risk, rapid trades, commonly referred to as scalping, and a trading approach that consistently relied on overleveraged entries. This is not a subjective opinion, but an assessment based on actual position sizing, execution timing, and trade duration. Funded accounts are granted to those whose strategies are sustainable and reproducible in real market environments. We do not penalize traders for short trades alone, but we do evaluate overall risk exposure and the ability to maintain consistent execution under real conditions, including liquidity and slippage, which differ significantly from simulated challenges. To say we “pretended” not to see your break-even trades is not only incorrect but misleading. Each position was reviewed in detail, and the feedback provided to you was specific and rooted in your trading history. The refund extended to you was a gesture of goodwill, acknowledging your time and effort, even though your strategy did not meet the funding standards. Lastly, our reviews reflect genuine customer experiences. While we encourage traders to leave honest feedback, we do not pressure anyone to post reviews, nor do we remove them unless they violate platform guidelines.

reviews.title: 90% of the positive you read here is…
reviews.content: 90% of the positive you read here is because they guilt trip you into writing a 5 star review when your facing a problem when reaching out to support. I’m gonna give you the hard truth about funding traders. I’ve been payed out and bought many challenges with them. I’ve become funded on multiple occasions, but rarely get an account because risk management team is not fair at all. I’ve traded my account from 5% drawdown these past 4 weeks to the funded stage (20%) with mostly 1 trade per day, except for this time. I was in phase 2 and I took 2 trades both taking around 3/4 min gaining 3 and 4% around 5min from each other apart, I saw the opportunity. I executed and passed phase 2. Thinking I would receive my funded account I’ve got a message from risk management that my form of trading is gambling. I traded on average 5% per week the last month. I’m not gambling, I backtested for days on end. So they offered me either a refund or a retake account. So today I traded the retake account and guess what, I couldn’t believe the spreads. Spreads went from average 0.15 on gold to now average 0.60 with spikes up to 0.70. This company is NOT TRUTHFULL. The ones responsible will be judged in the eyes of god.I wish I took my money from the get go to FTMO, The5ers, Funding Pips or anything else then this stupid propfirm. I’ve been trough it with these guys, this is not the first time they did this bullshit. They always do it, looking for a way to screw you over. Trust me don’t do it, the chance you become funded when you even reach the evaluation is lower then 10%.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Annan, Thank you for taking the time to share your perspective. However, it’s important to clarify several inaccuracies in your statement. At FundingTraders, our evaluation and funding decisions are never based on personal bias or arbitrary judgment. Every account undergoes a comprehensive review rooted in objective risk metrics that are clearly outlined. The claim that we "guilt trip" traders into leaving reviews is simply false, we encourage all feedback, both positive and negative, and make no attempt to influence it. Your trading activity was assessed based on consistency, sustainability, and adherence to sound risk management principles. Executing two high-risk trades in quick succession that result in a rapid phase pass does not align with the risk framework we have in place for funded accounts. Our goal is to support traders who demonstrate discipline and a long-term, replicable edge, not momentary gains based on highly aggressive strategies. As for spreads, we do not manually adjust them for individual users. Any fluctuations reflect real market conditions and liquidity levels provided by our partners, which affect all traders equally and transparently. We offered a fair resolution, including a retake, as a gesture of goodwill. We stand by our commitment to fairness, transparency, and the success of traders who align with our risk philosophy.

reviews.title: Stay away
reviews.content: Stay away! Read the 5 star reviews, they are all about customer service and not about the trading conditions or the payouts. The staff constantly ask for reviews regarding customer service! In one case they asked me to leave a review 7 times in a single day! They lower your account size upon passing a challenge! When you reach a payout they ask you to meet additional criteria, hoping that you will fail and lose your payout . They tried it with me! I originally made 5k payout submitted it they denied and said I had to place more trades making at least 50% profit . I was annoyed but decided to follow their additional instructions. I made another 5k bringing my payout to 10k . I submitted they denied saying I must make a single trade for the duration and same lot size as my largest winning trade. So I did just this and made another 5k bringing my payout to over 15k . They then denied again saying it can’t be through news . At this point I contacted a solicitor (lawyer) roughly 10 days later they paid my payout. Overall it took over a month to receive my payout from my initial first payout request . Avoid this company
reviews.reply_content: Hey Keiran, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, though we must respectfully correct several key inaccuracies in your statement. Firstly, we do not ask for reviews multiple times in a single day, nor do we solicit reviews with the intent to mislead. Any requests for feedback are made sparingly and are entirely optional. We pride ourselves on our transparency and encourage honest reviews, both positive and critical, to help improve our services. Our payout process is clearly outlined in our terms and remains consistent for all traders. We do not deny legitimate payouts for arbitrary reasons, and all assessments are based solely on compliance with our publicly shared guidelines. Lastly, suggesting that we only pay when legal pressure is applied is categorically untrue. We fulfill all valid payouts promptly and fairly. Any delay in your case, if it occurred, would have been tied to ensuring all compliance and risk checks were completed properly, a standard practice across the industry. We remain committed to supporting ethical and consistent traders and are always available to clarify any misunderstandings.

reviews.title: AVOID
reviews.content: If you are looking for a new prop firm, avoid this one and go for those that have already established a reputation, with clear and fair rules.FundingTraders has many very specific and unfair rules, including limits on single trades that could bust your account even if in the green. Forget the 5% daily rule and 10% total drawdown, these will not be your concern here.I have friends who have had their accounts downscaled or plain deleted because the prop firm didn't agree with their trading approach, even when following all the rules and running consistent profits.It's a zero-sum game with them - Draw you in with enticing rebates, reject your accounts and payouts based on petty rules and frivolous claims.Ahhh, but they'll claim this is to better know their traders and ensure they really only truly work with the worthy ones! Alas, this is only really a tactic to take your investment and encourage you to buy more challenges.They even had the guts to switch users to a Karios server, one that has down times I've never seen before, rendering you unable to trade, unable to close your trades even, while every one else in the world can still trade. Coupled with their insane rules, even if you maniacally try to follow them all, it's a matter of time before you receive an email that your account has been shut down, even if you were deep in the green.A refund for such issues they cause? Not an option, they say.There is no more dishonest, unethical and disgusting than such company that pretends to be so great to its traders, all while busting accounts left and right.You'll recognise the 5 star reviews as being requested by their staff. These ''clients'' are too early in the process to have been screwed - yet. The quick damage control by FundingTraders is evident, as is their money-grab scheme.Trust the many legit and detailed 1 star reviews don't be gaslighted - AVOID.

The limits on single trades and risk management measures are in place to protect traders and maintain the integrity of our platform. The experiences of a few individuals do not reflect the overall integrity of our firm. We stand by our commitment to support traders who demonstrate discipline and adherence to our guidelines. We are dedicated to providing a positive trading experience and appreciate the opportunity to address these issues.

reviews.title: Crap Risk Management Team
reviews.content: First of all, stoploss has been mentioned on their website that it is not mandatory but they always find ways to counter your passing of account which is to include stoploss for risk management purpose. Secondly, they limit your lot size for 'consistent purpose' even though the leverage allows for a bigger lot size. as usual, risking 1% to them is another reason for them to shoot you down.After running a stop loss and setting to breakeven, they will also find it risky.Do you guys even know how to trade?Thirdly, nothing on the website mentioned that individual trade must be 2 mins and above. All that is mentioned was the VWHT.And yet, when i calculate my own VWHT, it was WAY above VWHT. And yet, they still find fault with you and downsize your funded account.Are you guys looking for consistent traders or trying to eat our money?Lastly, the risk management team response is super slow. my last response was last tues, 2/4/25 and till now it has not been responded. We do emphasize the importance of VWHT (Volume-Weighted Holding Time) in our guidelines. I writing this review hoping to get a proper answer from them and to STRONGLY advice people to stay away from them if they don't completely change the way they handle things and start paying people who deserve to be paid.EDIT: today I received an email from the 'risk department' saying that I will receive my full payout and refund but my account will be terminated due to gambling. I had an open ticket without answers so I asked on discord to get an answer. The result? 7 days timeout. I only want to know when I'll receive my deserved payout which I requested a week ago and you'll never hear more from me.

reviews.title: FundingTraders Review: Unclear Rules, Incorrect Payouts, and Sudden Account Termination
reviews.content: I was a trader with FundingTraders and would like to share my experience to help others make informed decisions.After passing the evaluation and receiving a funded account, I was informed that my account would be reduced due to a "non-replicable strategy" based on trade duration and risk. When I asked for clarification on what specifically constituted risky trading behavior (e.g. lot size, duration, or movement), I was told that they couldn't provide exact parameters. This made it difficult to understand how the rules were applied or whether similar trades would be allowed in the future.I submitted a payout request (Ref ID: 1294) and experienced a delay beyond the stated 48 business hours. When the payout arrived, the amount was lower than expected. After reaching out, I was informed that it reflected 30% of my 90% profit share — a detail I hadn’t seen clearly communicated. I later received the partial refund that was also part of the termination terms.I also contacted the Risk Department via email to seek further clarification, but I have yet to receive a response, despite it being well past their stated reply window.In my personal experience, clearer communication and more transparency around payout calculations and trading evaluations would go a long way in improving the trader experience.

While we understand that individual trading styles can vary, it’s important to adhere to our established parameters to ensure consistency and fairness for all traders. Regarding the claim of unclear criteria, our risk management policies are explicitly stated. Each trader is responsible for understanding these rules before engaging in trading activities. As for payout requests, we strive to process all transactions within our stated timelines. Any delays that may occur are typically due to reasons out of our control. We handle all cases professionally and transparently, ensuring that traders receive the funds they have earned, in accordance with our payout structure. The suggestion that accounts are terminated without proper warning is misleading. Our risk management team conducts thorough reviews and only makes decisions based on clear evidence of rule violations. Any trader who engages with our platform in good faith is treated fairly, and we remain committed to supporting responsible trading practices. We value the input of all our traders and are always looking for ways to improve our services.

reviews.title: Funding Traders Is a Scam – Read This Before You Waste Your Money
reviews.content: Title: SCAM Tactics Disguised as “Rules” – AVOID Funding TradersThis firm is an absolute joke. I took their 2-Step Challenge, followed proper risk management, and stayed well within lot size discipline. Despite that, they disqualified me for supposedly breaking their so-called “consistency rule” — a vague, poorly defined, and conveniently enforced clause they use to fail traders.Here’s the catch: I placed three separate trades, not simultaneously, each with clear intent and spacing. Yet because the trades were opened or closed within two minutes of each other, they grouped them together and claimed I risked over 2% — which is false. It’s a blatant manipulation of their own rules to fail accounts once you get close to passing.They don’t support traders — they trap them with ambiguous technicalities. The consistency rule is nothing more than a loophole for them to pocket challenge fees without ever funding real traders. It’s predatory, dishonest, and unethical.There are way better prop firms out there that treat traders with respect and fairness. Funding Traders? Avoid them like the plague. Save your money and your time.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Atif, We take all feedback seriously and appreciate the opportunity to clarify our policies. The claim that our rules are “vague” or “manipulated” is incorrect. Our consistency rule is clearly stated in our terms, and it is designed to promote responsible risk management, ensuring traders demonstrate sustainable trading habits rather than relying on high-risk bursts. Marking an account as failed because of a rule violation is not an arbitrary decision but a standard practice across reputable prop firms to maintain integrity and fairness in funded trading. We understand that traders may be disappointed when they do not qualify, but our goal remains the same: to reward disciplined, consistent traders who follow our guidelines. Our track record of funding and paying successful traders speaks for itself.

reviews.title: WORST PROP FIRM SINCE MARCH 3RD
reviews.content: Since March 3rd, the updated news rule makes it nearly impossible to be a day or swing trader with this prop firm, only scalpers can use this firm now. Lets say for example, the London session opens at 8:00 AM GMT. It often takes time to find a proper setup, so you might enter a trade around 8:30 or 9:00 AM GMT. By the time the US market opens at 1:00 PM GMT, and with news often dropping around 1:30 PM GMT, this rule would affect your trade. Even though it was based on a setup from the London open, you’d still be impacted. With these new rules, swing traders can’t trade most days unless they focus only on the Asian session, as London news is less frequent. However, there’s US news around the US  market open almost every day, which means swing traders are basically  blocked from trading most days. I have never seen more ridiculous rule in any prop firm, please if u  don't know how to avoid news trading gamblers on your firm just copy the system bigger firms have because this rule makes no sense and it needs fix as soon as possible.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, At FundingTraders, our goal is to provide traders with a fair and structured environment that promotes responsible risk management. Our updated news trading rule is designed to ensure that traders are not exposing their accounts to excessive volatility and uncertainty caused by high-impact news events. This rule does not prevent day or swing traders from operating successfully, it simply encourages a more strategic approach to risk management. Many traders continue to execute their strategies effectively by planning around scheduled economic events, just as they would in a real trading environment. It’s important to note that high-impact news has always been a factor in risk management, and similar guidelines exist across the industry. We welcome constructive feedback and remain committed to refining our policies to support our traders while maintaining a responsible trading environment. If you require further clarification, our support team is happy to assist.

reviews.title: Scatchy prop, run away from them
reviews.content: Well, lets start from that i requested payout from them 3 times on same account: 1st time 5k$ they asked me to do more trades, I did and requested again and waited 17 days and was rejected again and asked to do more trade, and I did and asked 3rd time for payout of 9500$ ( had more than 11k$ profit on account) after few hours my account was reviewed and they told me that I will receive payment on Monday, on Tuesday I msged them in a chat they said everything is fine and nothing to worry about my payout already in process, 30 min later I received an email from Risk Department that saying I violated consistency rule because I opened 2 trades:First trade was opened at 16:10:11 and closed at 16:49:40second trade was opened AFTER not simultaneously!!!   1st trade was closed at 16:50:18 and closed at 17:10:23it was the same pair and in the same direction, i didn't open trade while the first was here, only afterIt's obvious that I didn't break any rules, otherwise their system would have blocked my account right away, + my account was reviewed on Friday, and they didn't find anything, now they decided to make something up, and it's clear that they just don't wanna pay It was 9500$ payout !!!And the funniest part is I was kicked from the funded discord, even so i have more accounts with this prop firmThere are plenty of people who wait their payouts for weeks and months if its more than 2-3k$ stay away from these guysIf you need I can provide all screenshots with all conversations

reviews.title: I would say trade with caution. Better not at all.
reviews.content: I am funded with a few different prop firms and I do trade my own capital.I have a very simple strategy I just buy pull backs after breakouts on gold. I will often place a small limit order maybe (0.3%) of my total trade idea risk on the first fib level with a stop way below. So naturally a lower lot size.This is just to be in the market if it runs off from the first level. Giving me then chance to bring in the stop and scale in. And then I have the rest of my pending orders maybe 0.5 or 0.7% of my risk waiting at my ideal fib level.The total risk per trade is less than or equal to 1% but as the second position has a tighter stop loss (as in the entry is closer to the stop loss) the lot size is slightly larger. This apparently is a martingale strategy (nonsense) and they closed my account. I think this is ridiculous. if a stop loss is in place and risk is calculated properly you cannot attach the label martingale to a trading strategy. It is simply understanding your risk and executing a trading strategy.  --- update 20/2/25----Yes your response is fine and to be expected. My review is an opinion and based on my experience only. However....Obviously greater weight is added to my opinon when read in conjunction with the other 14 pages of negative reviews who all seem to share similar grievances.A constructive solution might be to relax this "Martingale like" rule and allow traders to trade their position as long as they adhere to the set risk parameters"Update: 9/5/25I received an email at 9:30 AM to say that Funding Traders had flagged this review as containing defamatory content. And at 9:32 the review had been checked and determined as to not be defamatory. I think my message to anyone thinking about trading with this prop firm, trade with caution, better not at all. The multiple reviews speak volumes on the expected outcome for people looking to trade with them.
reviews.reply_content: We thoroughly reviewed your case and provided you with a detailed explanation via email, including trade IDs and position records that clearly indicated a Martingale-like strategy. Our rules explicitly prohibit such strategies, and this was communicated to you transparently. We do not fail traders arbitrarily; every decision is based on careful analysis and strict adherence to our policies. Our goal is to maintain a fair and consistent evaluation process for all traders.

reviews.title: DO NOT TRADE HERE
reviews.content: DO NOT TRADE HERE. This platform has a strict consistency rule limiting max loss to 2% per trade, which might seem reasonable—until you experience their terrible slippage.I passed both Phase 1 and Phase 2 of a $50K challenge, only to receive an email from risk management later, stating I had failed. On one of my trades, I set my stop loss at -$900, staying within the max trade loss limit. However, due to slippage, the trade closed at -$1,200—a $300 difference.I've traded with Apex, Topstep, and Tradeday, and this platform has, by far, the worst slippage. When I contacted support, they simply told me that traders should account for the possibility of "slippage” on their platform. In other words, I should have left an extra 0.6% buffer to compensate for their poor execution.Save your time and moneystay away from this platform.
reviews.reply_content: We understand your frustration, but we want to clarify that slippage is a normal market occurrence, especially during high volatility or low liquidity periods. It is not unique to our platform and can affect all traders regardless of their strategy. Our consistency rule explicitly states that traders must account for slippage when managing risk, as it can occasionally result in slightly higher losses than anticipated. This is a fundamental part of trading and risk management. All evaluations are conducted fairly, and account breaches only occur when a trader violates the established rules. If all rules had been followed correctly, the account would not have been marked as failed.

reviews.title: Purchasing a challenge from Funding traders is very risky!
reviews.content: I've just lost my 50k challenge for absolutely 0 fault on my side. What happened? As you know they have 2% max. risk per trade. I have been using strictly 0.5%($250) stoplosses on every trade I placed. Today my stoploss wasn't triggered on trade resulting of loss -920 USD. My account balance at the time was almost 51k so I don't get how it could lead to loss of the challenge. It is not 2%. This loss was purely technical execution fault either of a broker or a trade locker app. I had my -250 USD stoploss placed on a trade. When I made inquiry about it, support from Funding traders didn't help of course. They wrote something like they didn't find any irregularities. Not fair at all! 100% staying away from this company. Never purchase any challenge from them anymore and highly recommend not to so to anyone else if you don't want to lose your account just anytime no matter how much you try to be consistent, following your plan, risk management and all this when you can be taken down by system failure at any time..I'm more than happy to receive a response from the company re this issue here. I will happily adjust my negative review if they review my issue. But it is apparent they don't care about clients when they face technical issues leading to account closure. I knew 100% all the rules and did respect them and trade accordingly. Yet still I wasn't able to avoid loss of the account because when stoploss isn't triggered there's really zero chance for a trader to be able to do anything. It happened within seconds of big spike candle. I didn't have time to close trade manually. That's why we place stoplosses on our trades. But when they don't work what else can we do? Please think twice before purchasing a challenge from this company, you won't get any support if you face similar situation like this one. I'm real person, not an anonymous "hater" my intentions are not to harm a company reputation. I wrote my review just to help other traders make better choice before purchasing a challenge from Funding traders. Re: I add a comment after receiving response from Funding traders. They claim I have not placed a stoploss on my trade. Because there is no evidence on either side it is impossible to judge this review. I knew I've placed my stoploss because I don't trade without it in any case and I did see it clearly on a trade locker during my trade execution. But just the fact you have to be "fighting" to prove it shows their rules aren't very traders friendly because they are the only Prop firm (I know) that has the limit 2% per trade, which easily leads to account termination due to splippage, delayed stoplosses execution etc..
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Upon reviewing your TradeLocker account trade history, your claim that your stop loss wasn't triggered is simply not true because you never placed any stop loss. This clearly shows that the mistake was on your end and not ours or the broker's side. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: Unfair Account Termination – Misleading and Unethical Practices
reviews.content: I recently passed FundingTraders’ evaluation successfully, yet my account was unfairly flagged for allegedly using a Martingale strategy—which is completely false.	1.	False Accusation of Martingale Strategy	My trading strategy was based on technical analysis, strict risk management (0.5%–1% risk per trade), and structured entries/exits.	I never doubled my position size exponentially, as a true Martingale strategy would.My trades were based on EMA, MACD, ATR confirmations, not on random loss recovery and can provide my entry and exit price.	2.	Manipulative and Unfair Evaluation Process	They approved my challenge pass, but later flagged me for a few trades, conveniently after I completed the evaluation.	My PnL curve shows stable growth, which is impossible for a Martingale trader.	I have successfully passed funding evaluations at other prop firms, withdrawn profits, and never had this issue before.So for people who want to buy a challenge in this firm beware of this. This company has the right to interpret their rules, even if they are unreasonable.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We have 3 different scans - Live scanning: during taking the challenge - Post challenge scanning: analyzing your trade logs - Manual review: before getting to the funded stage or after requesting for a payout Even if the system didn't instantly automatically mark your account as "Failed" after a violation, your account will still be reviewed after completing the challenge phases. We've clearly stated in our Help Center that a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first. In your case, you added more than 1 position on an already losing trade idea, please refer to the screenshot on the email the Risk Department sent to you. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: Awful 1 step program
reviews.content: In generally I have nothing to highlight extra good in this firm. Only constant discounts (that is good for your wallet, but shows that they try to attract more users) and ability to buy big accounts, but this imho is possible just because if their bunch of hard rules. I can not say anything about it's funded accounts, because they denied after passing challenge due to breaching consistency rule (one stop was 2.05% instead of maximum 2).Also they have more weird rules.1. Martingale rule. You can not add more than once to your already loosing position. So a lot of strategies are not able to use with this company2. 1-step program is the worst I have ever seen. Besides that your daily loss decreased to 4% and maximum loss to 5%, the most weird thing is that your maximum loss is relates to your maximum balance (wtf). So you can make intraday +3%, that take loss 1% and your maximum loss turns to be 4%, dispite your overall profit for example 5%, daily profit 2%, but you are in loosing situation. So you can not take good positions with higher stop-loss, because your situation never turns to be good enough for risk, you can not stay away from your maximum loss, you can only become closer to lose your account. So you always fell psychological pressure.It seems to be a trap, because usually 1-step and 2-step programs difference is size of maximum losses. And they will not change your account even if you are in profit and just discovered this ruleThere is no reasons to choose this prop-firm, imho. A lot of rules that can be used against you.

reviews.title: Passed both stages of a 2-stage 50k…
reviews.content: Passed both stages of a 2-stage 50k funded challenge. They then claim that I have broken their martingale rule which is as follows. "To put a clear line, a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first." They state that a trading idea is the following "A trade idea is categorized as one if:- It was floating, or opened at the same time at one point on the same symbol and direction or;- The trades are closed and opened within 2 minutes of each other on the same symbol and direction"The trades they flagged me for were all placed within 1 minute to allow me to manage the trade idea in smaller positions and have different TP's. Making it 1 trading idea as per their rules.They have claimed this is a rule breach anyway and won't reply to my emails. AVOID THIS COMPANY
reviews.reply_content: We thoroughly reviewed your account and provided you with detailed trade IDs and images illustrating how your trading strategy violated our martingale rule. Our policies clearly state that adding multiple positions to a losing trade must follow specific guidelines, which were not adhered to in this case. All evaluations are conducted fairly, and account breaches only occur when a rule is violated. Our team has responded to your inquiries with full transparency, outlining the exact reasons for the breach. We encourage all traders to carefully review the rules before participating to ensure compliance.

reviews.title: I used to really defend funding traders… But Now!!!
reviews.content: I used to really defend funding traders above other propfirms. I am a super big believer in customer service, support,clarity of rules. Bt today I realized that I was wrong. After fighting and battling through my phase 1&2 challenges they told me I'm not going to get funded. Because I placed a trade before news happened and even kept the trade open after news but because I made a significant amount of money they are choosing to not honor my trade. As a trader I've purchased over 16 challenges through them because I believed in the company and their customer support. But as of today the way the handled me both in discord and through email is unacceptable. I will however say that they did give me an option to eith re-take the whole challenge or refund my money. Which is positive for them. The simple fact being I broke no rules and the way they banned me from discord for asking question and trying to gain clarity is sooo unprofessional!!! They didn't even give an option to say you know what we'll give you the chance to retake phase 2. No they want me to take phase 1&2 over again. Mind you they gave me my phase 2 credentials weeks ago and when I finally pass phase 2 and am waiting for my funded credit also decide to tell me my phase 1 is no good. How do you do that to someone? Especially a loyal client who's spent so much money with your firm. So with funding traders be very careful of their rules. Also remember their drawdown rules as well. And even though they say news trading allowed it's at their discretion!!! Definitely go with a firm that honors their rules and payout procedures! I also have all my screenshot and correspondences between me and funding traders to show how unprofessionally they treated me and my situation today. Especially when all I wanted was clarity and to come to an amacable resolution.

reviews.title: Unfair Trading Practices and Poor Support
reviews.content: I’ve had an extremely disappointing experience with Funding Traders and feel compelled to share it. My trades have been repeatedly stopped out despite being 20 or more pips away from my set stop loss, which is completely unacceptable. When I raised the issue with their support team, I was told it was due to “spread widening” caused by low liquidity, and that my stop loss is triggered by the bid or ask price, which isn’t visible on my MT5 chart. As a swing trader who holds positions overnight or over the weekend, this explanation doesn’t justify the fact that my trades—often in good profit—get unfairly stopped out. When I asked for a solution to prevent this from happening in the future, the support team didn’t respond and went ahead to close my ticket without any resolution. This was the second time I raised this issue, and each time it was dismissed without meaningful assistance.The combination of unfair trading conditions and terrible customer support that closes your support ticket without resolution is unethical, doesn't inspire confidence and makes Funding Traders highly unreliable. A legitimate prop firm will prioritize transparency, fairness, and customer support, none of which I experienced here. If you’re a serious trader, I recommend looking for a firm with better practices and accountability.Happy to update my review if my issue is fixed, until then, it'll remain so others can be aware.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Be reminded that different brokers may offer different market rollover conditions due to their difference in liquidity providers. We warned our traders about spreads widening during market rollover on our Help Center. With regards to the bid and ask price, take note that the candles only prints the bid price, and that it is your responsibility to enable the ask price line on your MT5 application, not ours, so you may clearly see the spread on your chart. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: I wasn't expecting to receive a payout
reviews.content: I wasn’t expecting to receive a payout, but this funding firm is a complete disappointment. It’s possibly the least transparent one out there. To those who opted for this firm, I sympathize; there are certainly better alternatives with standard rules that don’t seem designed to block payouts. The process is slow, and the treatment feels dishonest and disrespectful. I apparently broke one of their clearly stated rules (martingale), but it’s such a dumb rule to impose on traders. They claim it’s meant to prevent traders from going all in, but I risked under 0.5%, so how could I possibly blow my account? It’s just a convenient excuse for them to avoid paying out. Funny enough, they didn’t catch this during the evaluation phase—only when it came time for payout. And after failing me, they had the audacity to offer a 20% discount code. That alone is a major red flag for any prop firm.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We have 3 different scans - Live scanning: during taking the challenge - Post challenge scanning: analyzing your trade logs - Manual review: before getting to the funded stage or after requesting for a payout Even if the system didn't instantly automatically mark your account as "Failed" after a violation, your account will still be reviewed after completing the challenge phases. Any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination. As a trader, it is your responsibility to know all the rules associated with the account you purchased. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: Horrible slippage
reviews.content: Friends, don’t waste your time on this company. Let me share my experience. I purchased a $100K account and successfully passed the first phase. During the second phase, I opened a trade with a stop loss set at $1,700, as the rules prohibit losses exceeding 2% per trade. However, the trade was closed at -$2,039, which is already a violation.The instrument was Nasdaq, the lot size was 0.14, it was the Asian session, and there were no news events. The slippage amounted to $339, and the account was blocked.I work with several prop firms, and this one truly surprised me. If you value your time, don’t get an account here because, even if you try to control your trade risks, you won’t be able to.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Trade locker uses depth of market in filling orders which makes it accurate to live trading conditions with regards to slippages. Additionally, stop losses are not guaranteed at the exact price you placed, these only stop orders which are filled at the best price possible. The best price possible is dependent on the liquidity and volatility at any moment.

reviews.title: technical malfunctions that led to account cancellation
reviews.content: HelloI want to tell you about the situation with my Funded account!When I purchased and paid for the challenge, the company’s terms and conditions included the following functions:1.- Profit split 80% -0% additional payment;- Profit split 90% - +15 additional payment;2.- Payout time -14 days - 0% additional payment;- Payout time -7 days - +25% additional payment;3.-2% risk per transaction - 0% additional payment;-2.5% risk per transaction - +20% additional payment;4.- Conditions: no commission - 0%. to additional payment;- Conditions: no commission and swaps - +15% additional payment;I emphasize, point 4, which states that the account with the conditions is “no commission”conclusion: - The commission itself was not displayed in the trading terminal "TradeLocker"; it is not visible, even after the transaction is closed;- The commission and the result of transactions were also not displayed in the Profit and Loss report, it simply did not exist, which did not give me the opportunity to simply stop trading.All this influenced the result, misleading me as a trader. Therefore my account was canceled by mistake.I really hope that the CEO will see and consider this assessment personally and will be able to influence this situation.

reviews.title: I paid for a promo BOGO on new years…
reviews.content: I paid for a promo BOGO on new years and didn't receive it. I put in a support ticket to report the bug and included I paid on 12/31...started purchase on 12/30 to make sure it was applied...I had to finalize checkout...it sent me an email saying it was a problem with my payment when there wasn't. SO there had to been a tech issue. I attempted to enter ticket and support used the flawed invoice that didn't reflect code which was the damn complaint that my code wasn't applied and then put me in time out on Discord. I had numerous platform fails, server fails, and blackouts that blew challenges daily drawdowns due to reset timer. Several challenges were sabotaged. I had several daily drawdown violations after platform opened multiple trades that I never entered due to fails, so I never officially blew some of my challenges my dashboard was bugged. Since then the dashboard has been updated to a nice format I like so I thought the revamp was an improvement in practice I have to restate how messed up it is that I called to report bug and get access to second account I PAID FOR and be treated like a Liar by OBI WAN and placed me in a time out because he didn't understand that my complaint was the code wasn't applied and used the invoice that I was complaining about to say I didn't apply a code rather than deducing a tech bug. A damn Joke. He put me in time out on Discord without truly understanding my complaint...lol. As long as I've been trading with them What sense would it be that I would make the mistake of not being sure to apply a BUY ONE GET ONE FREE CODE but I paid attention enough to pay on 12/31/24. I thought they respected experienced traders more. IM NOT HAPPY WITH THIS COMPANY AT ALL AT THIS POINT!!UPDATE: it absolutely was charging me 99 dollars at first and then it changed to 100 dollars at checkout...all you guys have to do is go into your checkout log to see the code was indeed applied and I received an email to finalize  my checkout. I stated in complaint to support that it was charging me 99 dollars at first then changed to 100 dollars at checkout. I wrote that in support ticket. I really dont feel you looked into it honestly. The most interesting thing about all this is instead of preserving a net positive relationship and resolving it with a benefit of the doubt bonus account because I ended up paying more to receive a Bonus account for the same money you insist on trying to make me look bad and inaccurate review. I have a new complaint. ABSOLUTELY PISS POOR CUSTOMER RETENTION. YOU ARE TRYING TO make me look like a LIAR. RESOLVING THIS ISSUE PROPERLY would've cost you nothing because the code was an additional account that was already covered by what I paid. Because of the lack of self awareness, you've escalated a rather simple issue to resolve by insisting that somehow I made a mistake. Your company's platform has plenty of tech bugs and its documented.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Rico, After reviewing your payment, it appears that the BOGO code was not successfully applied. Our system shows no record of any promo codes being used with the account you provided. Additionally, if the BOGO code had been applied correctly, the total cost would have been $99 instead of $100, reflecting an additional $1 discount. This suggests the issue occurred on your end during the checkout process.

reviews.title: THIS PROP FIRM IS A SCAM
reviews.content: THIS PROP FIRM IS A SCAMI successfully completed phase 1 and 2 for a 200k evaluation requiring 10%. I took 2 trades and gained 1%. I also purchased 7-day Payout Ad on, which cost an extra 20% of the final cost. It took them 3 weeks to review my Payout Request and at the end the told me I violated the Martingale rule. When they showed me my trades that violated the rule, it was 2 positions, 1 of .02 lots and the other was .03 lots. So the breached my account and denied my payout over .01 lots, less than a penny.Before they violated me, I purchased a second account as well. I continued trading this account just to see if they would do the same shady thing and of course they did. Same exact thing  except this time it was after I passed phase 2, it took 3 weeks for them to review just to breech my account and take my hard earned money. They claimed I violated the rule in phase 1 by placing a position that was .01 and another that was .02. I explained to them that this is a common issue when trading on a trade copier and is not a violation of any sort. The funny thing is, I trade with multiple prop firms at a time on a trade copier, and I took the exact same trades with other firms who have the same rules and they honored the agreement and paid me.Their response was BS "we have to have strict rules to make a fair trading environment for everyone. Except I am apart of "everyone" and this is completely unfair to me. I understand Rules and I do my best not to violate them but to take my money and my account over less than 1 cent TWO TIMES is BOGUS.I've been trading with Prop Firms for over 2 years now, I've had good and bad experiences, this is by far the worst company I've ever done any type of business with in any space.Look closely at the bad reviews, you will see many people have this same exact complaint. You will also see a rep from this firm in the comments trying to justify but there is no justification for such shady and predatory business practices. PLEASE STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PROP FIRM. ONCE THEY BREACH YOU , THEY WILL NOT GIVE YOU YOUR MONEY BACK AND YOU WILL HAVE WASTED VALUABLE TIME AND MONEY.Edit: Just as I mentioned, they responded with mention of "Fairness" but fail to realize that this is in fact not fair to anyone. We are talking about incremental and fractional amounts here. I paid $3000 for 2 accounts and had $2500 payout due yet you take away all of that over $0.01. Yeah totally fair. Like I said, this prop firm is a joke and a rip off
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, As a firm principle, we require all our traders to strictly adhere to the established rules to maintain consistency and fairness across all accounts. It is essential for us to uphold the integrity of our trading rules to ensure a level playing field for all traders. In the event of a trading rule or objective being violated, the trader will lose trading access and privileges. It's essential to note that if a trader has generated profits in a funded account during the trading period and subsequently violates a rule, those profits will be forfeited. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: Room for improvement
reviews.content: I have been with Funding Traders since December 6, 2024. I received my first payout today. Here are the pros & cons:Pros:- Fast response. There are a lot of helpful people in the company and they respond pretty fast even if they can’t resolve the issue right away. - Decent trading conditions- Good communityCons:- Slow payout as it took 9 days for my first payout. During the 9 days, I was not able to trade. The larger the payout, the longer it will take for them to pay you. - Did not receive the 100k after passing both phases. Instead, I received 50k because the risk team said “Most of the profits of your evaluation came from only 1 trade in both of your phases”.  I wished they said that from the beginning. However, they did refund me the price difference and gave me the chance to still receive the 100k account if I gain 10%.- The dashboard sometimes glitches (minor issue).To be fair, they are pretty new and the holidays made it more difficult to process everything. Also, they do plan on launching a lot of cool stuff in the future. But as of now, the firm has a lot of work to do and there is room for improvement. I want to thank Bugsplat, Sensei, Leo, and Ced for helping me with some of my issues.

reviews.title: They're not paying. Reviews are fake/bought/artifical. Check their Discord before purchasing
reviews.content: My experience with this proprietary trading firm has been incredibly disappointing and unprofessional. The company appears to be mismanaged and lacks transparency, raising serious concerns about their integrity. After over six weeks of waiting for a payout, my request has been denied twice. The reason provided was that I closed trades more than 30 minutes before a scheduled news event—a rule that was retroactively enforced. This directly contradicts their website, which explicitly states that news trading is allowed. Additionally, I received an email from the company outlining that only trades executed within 10 minutes before and after news events would be considered news trading. The additional 30-minute restriction was only communicated on their Discord server, which I also adhered to. Despite fully complying with these rules, my payout was still denied.Customer support has been unhelpful throughout this process, often ignoring inquiries or closing tickets without resolution. Unfortunately, I am not alone in facing these issues. A review of their Discord community reveals a troubling pattern of similar complaints, with numerous traders reporting denied payouts and retroactively applied rules seemingly designed to avoid paying clients.This lack of consistency, transparency, and professionalism makes it impossible for me to recommend this firm. I strongly advise anyone considering their services to stay away as far as possible. Talked to risk team for 2 Months, they ended up closing my account and paying me 30% of my payout without any rule breach, Im taking legal action now. Check their Discord and other ratings before purchasing. Theyre a complete scam and wont be around for much longer
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Please refer and continue the conversation on the email you received from the Risk Department.

reviews.title: Expérience très mitigée
reviews.content: FundingTraders semble bien… au début. Mais ensuite on se rend compte qu'ils ne fournissent pas toutes les règles lors de l'achat d'un challenge, il faut fouiller la FAQ pour les trouver, ce qui n'est pas très honnête. Ensuite le dashboard a souvent des bugs d'affichage et des délais de mise à jour, ce qui peut éventuellement induire en erreur en cours de trading. Et pour finir, ils ne répondent pas du tout aux e-mails (pourtant en anglais). Ce n'est pas ce que j'appelle un prop firm de qualité, je ne le vous conseille pas.FundingTraders seems good… at first. But then you realize that they don't provide all the rules when purchasing a challenge; you have to dig through the FAQ to find them, which isn't very honest. Furthermore, the dashboard often has display bugs and update delays, which could potentially lead to errors during trading. And finally, they don't respond to emails at all (even in English). This is not what I call a quality prop firm; I don't recommend it.

reviews.title: Please Read "Unfair Practices and Lack of Transparency"
reviews.content: Please Read before buying funding traders challenge.My experience with Funding Traders has been deeply disappointing. I participated in their $50,000 account challenge and successfully passed both Phase 1 and Phase 2, adhering strictly to all their stated rules and guidelines. Despite this, my funded account was not approved, and their reasoning was both arbitrary and unsupported by any of their documented policies.  Upon thoroughly reviewing their website, help center, and terms of service, I found no mention of rules regarding time limitations on trades or restrictions on short scalps. Yet, these unstated criteria were cited as the basis for their decision. This lack of transparency wastes participants' time and undermines trust in their evaluation process.  Furthermore, their claim of over-leveraging was baseless. If over-leveraging were truly an issue, the account would have been blown. Instead, I exercised proper risk management, which they should have recognized and rewarded. Penalizing traders for following sound trading practices not only contradicts their own principles but also diminishes their credibility as a professional firm.  The handling of my case has been unprofessional and reflects poorly on the company. I urge potential customers to be cautious when dealing with Funding Traders. My experience suggests they enforce arbitrary rules that are not communicated upfront, wasting both time and effort.  Additionally, their refund process has been inconvenient. I do not have a Stripe account and requested a direct refund to my bank account, but this issue remains unresolved.  In conclusion, I would not recommend Funding Traders to serious traders. Transparency, fairness, and professionalism are critical in this industry, and unfortunately, they have failed to demonstrate any of these qualities.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Please refer to the explanation the Risk Department has provided on the email as to why they were not able to advance your account to the next stage. Be reminded that we are on the hunt for traders that we can have a long-term win-win relationship with. We are not looking to fund just anyone. We're only backing traders that pass the evaluations and showcase a great understanding of risk management and trade executions. Please continue the conversation with the Risk Department if you have other concerns or inquiries regarding your case.

reviews.title: It's up to them to interpret the rules
reviews.content: News trading is allowed in their trading rules, and after I passed my 100k account, the risk department said that most of my profits were made through news trading. The second point is that they need to maintain consistent trading, so set an order with a stop loss amount that cannot exceed 2% of your total capital. ok I also agree with this point of view, but the lots calculated based on different stop loss pips are also different, especially when the market fluctuations are small, under the same stop loss amount, different order lots will be calculated. So in this case, they directly reduced my 100k account to 50k account, and I don’t know if I chose 100% profit sharing, which wasted my time and energy, which is unacceptable.last updateI received a partial refund.But this is not the point.The rules they wrote on their official website are inconsistent with the actual operations.‘Consistency Rule Representation:Allowed:Open GOLD BUY (2% risk/loss) > Close trade > Open GOLD BUY (2% risk/loss) > Close trade2% risk/loss on single trade idea. Open GOLD BUY (2% risk/loss) > Open AUDUSD BUY (2% risk/loss) > Open GBPJPY SELL (2% risk/loss) >  Close trade2% risk/loss(each) on multiple trade ideas. Open GOLD BUY (1% risk/loss) > Open GOLD BUY (1% risk/loss) > Close trade2% risk/loss on single trade idea.’Every order I make is based on market volatility.Since a 2% loss/rise is allowed, the size of my stop loss pips will affect the position size.The 1% loss/rise I set for the stop loss pips of 200pips and 400pips will cause my position size to be doubled.You said that 2% loss/rise is allowed, but then you warned me that the different position sizes caused by doing so are not allowed.This thing is really ridiculousGuys, don’t trust prop firms with huge discounts (40%)
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Please refer to the explanations provided by the Risk Department on the email they sent to you regarding your concern. Also, be reminded that you'll receive a partial refund soon as your account was downscaled.

reviews.title: RULES
reviews.content: They put a rule that you cannot lose more then 2% of the balance for a single trade. The positions you're opening after the first trades 2 minute window considered as a single trade as well. Even after you started to accumulate a position with no high risk, splitting your position size with 3 or more trades, they consider it as gamble. In the case they refused to give me my funded account after i passed the 1 step challenge, They considered my split entries as Martingale.As i wrote they should've considered the 2 minute window entries as a single trade, i even managed to enter positions after 4-5 minutes. And those shouldn't be considered as the same trade. I managed to have a 70% win rate over 100 trades for a month, had an 10% increase in the balance without losing not more than 2% for the trades, they found a way to fail you by made up reasons. After not breaking even a rule and successfully traded the challenge, they didn't even offered giving a refund or delete the problematic trades for you to continue trading.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Dirk, We've clearly stated in our Help Center that a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first. In your case, you added more than 1 position on an already losing trade idea, this is why your account has been marked as failed. Please refer to the screenshots we provided in our email. https://help.fundingtraders.com/en/articles/8050960-are-martingale-systems-and-arbitrage-trading-allowed Due diligence is important as a trader. We don't offer refunds or retake for accounts with trading rule violations.

reviews.title: I recently had a frustrating experience…
reviews.content: I recently had a frustrating experience with Funding Traders regarding their rule enforcement and overall trader support. Here are the key issues I faced, along with ongoing complaints that seem common among other traders:	1.	Alleged Rule Violation: I was accused of violating their policy on adding positions to losing trades. Their rules explicitly state that a trader may add only one position to a losing trade idea, provided it is not larger than the first position. The flagged trades were:	•	Trade IDs: 2952774, 2960519, 2961428	•	Trade IDs: 2934316, 2931232, 2941041After careful analysis, it is clear that my trades followed these rules. No excessive position sizes, martingale strategies, or grid trading techniques were used. Even their own AI assistant confirmed that I did not break any rules, but their risk team insisted otherwise, which feels arbitrary and unfair.	2.	Payout Delays: A significant problem with Funding Traders is the long payout delays. Many traders, have faced excessive waiting periods for withdrawals, despite fulfilling all profit split requirements. Additionally, there are frequent complaints about payouts being delayed by the risk team, who often ask traders to “trade minimum 5 more orders for another week” if they generate significant profits from a single trade. This kind of stalling tactic is highly unprofessional.	3.	Unclear and Inconsistent Rules: Many traders complain about Funding Traders’ interpretation of their own rules. The guidelines are vague, and enforcement often seems to be a matter of opinion rather than clear-cut policy. For example, common practices like closing and reopening trades or splitting positions are penalized despite being allowed in the stated rules.	4.	Community Complaints: These issues are not isolated. There are numerous complaints from traders about delayed payouts, inconsistent rule interpretation, and a lack of transparency. It seems the firm prioritizes finding loopholes to penalize traders rather than fostering a supportive trading environment.Conclusion:While Funding Traders promises a good funded trading experience, their execution leaves much to be desired. Long payout delays, arbitrary rule enforcement, and poor communication make it difficult to trust the platform. Traders should exercise caution when using this service, especially if they are serious about consistent payouts or fair treatment.I strongly urge Funding Traders to address these issues, clarify their rules, and improve their payout processes to regain trader trust.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We've clearly stated in our Help Center that a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first. In your case, you added more than 1 position on an already losing trade idea, please refer to the screenshots we provided in our email. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT TRUST AT ALL
reviews.content: Hi everyone;I never comment or complain usually about any company but this time I could not stand for it. I passed phase 1 and phase 2 of the challenges and while I was waiting for my funded account, they regretted to give me a funded account and the excuse was I failed the %2 risk rule. I have been trading for over 8 years and I know how to calculate my stop loss limits including spreads and everything. I calculated each of my trades carefully to not fail on the %2 rule but because of slippage 3 of my trades were closed way different than my stop loss price. And the slippage difference price difference was around $200-$300. I understand that slippage can be $100-$150 on a $100.000 challenge account which is 20 lots per GBPUSD trade but come on not $300 slippage to force you to fail the challenge. (it wasn’t even rollover time as I'm a day trader it was on the London session) Whoever knows how to trade will understand this is too much and traders can only calculate the spreads difference but not the broker's slippage difference because it always changes. I also have evidence of my trades that I could show them, but they keep sending me the same emails. So now I accepted that they wouldn’t give me a funded account, and I asked for a refund, but now they also don’t want to give me a refund. Imagine you spend a lot of effort and time to pass the challenge, and they are just basically stealing all your hard work. This is not fair at all and everyone who reads this PLEASE PLEASE do not buy any challenges from this company as they are not honest about their rules at all. At least they could have offered me a refund as it wasn’t my false at all but they don’t even bother to do that. This shows clearly that they are only making money from your challenge fees. I will seek another option to complain about this company if I could (I don’t think I could find a way), but at least I could try every possible way. Again, I never write any complaints usually, and I had challenges in the past with many prop firms, but come on, this is not acceptable, and everyone should stay away from this company while there are other options like FTMO or other trustworthy ones.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Hakan, Trade locker uses depth of market in filling orders which makes it accurate to live trading conditions with regards to slippages. Additionally, stop losses are not guaranteed at the exact price you placed, these only stop orders which are filled at the best price possible. The best price possible is dependent on the liquidity and volatility at any moment. We've clearly stated in our Help Center that the max. risk/loss (including floating loss) per trade idea is 2% of the initial account balance. Please be reminded that additional trading rule violation reviews are only conducted after completing the challenge phases or requesting for a payout. Any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination. As already explained to you on email, we don't offer refunds for failed accounts.

reviews.content: I spent a lot of time and effort to get ~$10,000 profit of 100,000 account but Fundingtraders did not pay profit to my account #805278. I created many tickets requesting payment starting from 09/02/2024. They always said my account is under review and I should be patient. I have been patient for 3 months. Whenever I asked, they said they are reviewing and asked me to wait more. They did not provide any evidence that I violated their rules because I did not violate anything. reviews.title: BEWARE OF THIS SCAM
reviews.content: BEWARE OF THIS SCAM! AVOID IT LIKE A PLAGUE! First of all, I want to address all of the 5 star reviews that this scam website has gotten. If you read through them, you notice that 95% of them are people giving 5 star review based on their chat that they have had with their help desk. But this is not a Information Service it is a Prop firm so all these votes are just invalid. Now let's get to my story of how I got scammed even after passing the 2 phase challenge. I passed the 2 phase challenge and get their "Congratulations" email that mentioned now my account is being reviewed. After around 12 hours I get an email that my account has been flagged as HFT and I have failed. They send a screenshot of the 3 trades that I took to test my local trade copier. These trades were only 0.01 lot and were closed instantly with the loss of less than $1. What is HFT? Anyone who know just a bit about trading knows that High-Frequency Trading (HFT) is a method of getting in the market with very large lot size and getting out very quickly in order to get some profit. You tell anyone who even has 1 month experience in trading that someone is doing "HFT" using 0.01 lot they'll just laugh at your face. This just shows that the guys behind Funding Traders are complete scammers and just want a reason to steal your money even if the reason is utterly ridiculous and doesn't even make sense. So do yourself a favour and go trade with a prop firm that will value your money and skill and your time. Unlike these clowns. HFT with entering the market with 0.01 lot :)) what a joke!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, We've clearly stated on our Help Center that trades that lasts 15 seconds or less are not allowed. As a firm principle, we require all our traders to strictly adhere to the established rules to maintain consistency and fairness across all accounts. It is essential for us to uphold the integrity of our trading rules to ensure a level playing field for all traders.

We suggest you try our 2-step accounts instead.

reviews.title: Order executed at a price that never reach
reviews.content: I have 2 XAUUSD orders running and my SL point is at 2640.5 . And somehow my SL got triggered at the time of 20/11/2024 15:26 (UTC +2) , but when I check back on their MT5 terminal, the highest price it reached is 2640.45, yet my order SL got triggered for no reason. I lost 180USD from this and got a daily drawdown breach which is another thing the system is a total failure. I have another DE40 order running at a profit around 60USD at the same when the SL got triggered, my daily drawdown breach is just merely 4USD over and obviously the running profit of DE40 could cover this drawdown, but yet the system still flagged my account as breached.Contacted the support via Discord, all of them keep throwing me generic FAQ answer and no one wants to really look into my explanation and conduct an investigation on why the order executed when the price never even reached my SL price. Really fed up with these kind of attitude where they choose which question is more convenient to answer and ignore the facts.Update: So after leaving a 1 star review here, finally a support with some knowledge able to point out my mistake and answer my questions. Bunch of them in discord just know how to throw in generic FAQ answers. So I decided to change to 3 stars due to the lack of knowledge and incompetence of the support team in Discord.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Jason, That is due to spreads. Please be reminded that the chart only shows the bid price. Buy order(buy order to close a sell/short position) are filled at ask price. It is your balance that hit the drawdown limit because of your 2 XAUUSD trades.
