reviews.title: Transparency and Communication Gaps
reviews.content: I started with this prop firm in March 2024 by purchasing a $200K account before they migrated to Tradelocker. Initially, MT5 and CTrader were the available platforms, and I chose MT5. However, shortly after, the firm transitioned to Tradelocker, which had numerous issues at launch. There were many reported errors and significant disruptions (evident in their Discord discussions), including slippage, incorrect lot sizing, and problems with opening or managing trades. One of my trades was affected, resulting in a $46 over-risk error for their 2% Rule. (I trade 1% only) While some clients received compensation for similar issues, I was not reimbursed despite providing evidence, and questioning if they looked at it.Communication over email and Discord felt unresponsive and generic, lacking tailored support for specific issues. As a trader who prioritizes risk management, it was disappointing not to see more personalized responses, especially when evidence was provided.The firm's consistency rule, while understandable, is presented in a way that can be confusing. It’s a nested rule not immediately flagged by the system, potentially causing traders to unknowingly violate it after months of trading. The dashboard does not notify the trader of these issues until a manual review is conducted, which raises questions about its utility.For any prop firm aiming to be the best, it’s crucial to listen to customer feedback and provide clear, simplified rule explanations. The current "per trade idea" rule could be clarified further, considering that traders interpret information differently.On a positive note, once Tradelocker stabilized and the firm resolved its initial connectivity and broker issues, the platform operated smoothly. I found some of Tradelocker’s features to be better than MT5, and it’s clear the platform team is receptive to feedback, as updates have been frequent. When the system worked, executing trades was straightforward and reliable.In summary, while the trading experience improved over time, addressing unique issues remains a significant challenge for this firm. Communication often felt automated and lacked a personalized touch. Discord responses were particularly dismissive, and email support frequently referenced prior exchanges rather than taking ownership of errors, putting the onus back on the user. This kind of response creates frustration and diminishes trust, especially when evidence is provided.The firm’s approach to handling rule violations could also be more transparent to help traders avoid confusion. While they offered a discount to retake the challenge, many traders prioritize integrity and proper handling of issues over mere financial incentives.Despite these setbacks, I would consider trying this firm again if they enhance their system's ability to detect violations promptly and make the dashboard more functional rather than focusing solely on aesthetics. Clear, straightforward rule explanations and genuine transparency would go a long way in building trust and improving the overall experience for clients.

reviews.title: Mixed experiences…
reviews.content: Mixed experiences:Everyone who is considering going with this propfirm please be aware of their not so emphasized rules that you can only find if you go and seriously study their terms. It is also hard to understand what they mean exactly.The one in particular I’m talking about if I understood it correctly is that your daily loss of 4/5% is only partially true. What they hide in the details is that if you open a position less then 2 minutes from another position that goes the same direction those positions basically counts as one, so if both positions hit 1% loss now that counts as 2% and once the loss percentage combined goes above 2% you have lost the challenge.This is what they call trade IDEA in their consistency rules.so we can say that the 2% loss per trade again is partially true, very clever with the words used. Be aware they are smart people, and their business model is not to find profitable traders or at least not their first objective for sure with these let’s say complicated rules.Their platform and app is ok, and they have news trading or at least you won’t lose your account if you open a position during news event. Pricing is reasonable compared to other firms but if you decide to go with them study their terms because they are no different than any other firm, as each have a unique rule (trap) that you can fall in.Now I have to go and study FTMO’s rules again because so far I believe they are the only ones that have no shady rules and you can trade as you like. They are on the pricier side but after this experience I think it’s worth paying that extra.

reviews.title: Used top be a great company till...
reviews.content: I worked with this company over a year and everything was great. Support was helpful, there was a good community. But something changed. They created a new dashboard system and since than all payouts are taking very long time. And people are complaining.I left company a few moments ago. I quit all their discord channels and i will never go back. Reason for this is, i don't trust them anymore. Allow me to elaborate.They have a %2 percent rule. If a trader loses more than %2 of his/her account in a single trade idea, the account is failed. In a trade, i've risked %1.8 with a stop/loss. And there was no major news event. And i was using their platform called TradeLocker which is unfortunately notorious for bad slippages even non-news event times. And trade went south, i made %1.98 loss but there was also commisions so i thought i think i've failed the account. I opened a ticket and asked if i breached the rule and i told them if i did, i want to know NOW. A guy told me that everything was fine and i could continue trading. And i made 560 USD on that account. I have all the visual proofs for this.Long story short, after making me wait a couple of days they told me i had breached their consistency rule and my account had failed and i wasn't getting paid. They offered me a same size free retake (of the account) but i didn't accept it. Now listen to this:I admit that %1.8 risk for %2 lost limit is a little over. That is on my end. But what is the limit? %1.7? %1.6? Who can %100 say %1.5 is secure? Because, as i said, only proper tool they are offering is TradeLocker and it is notorius for horrible horrible slippage's to ruin your trade event non-news times. So how can anyone feel safe with a tool like this?And worse part is, i can't work with this company anymore because you suddenly learn that an employee from the company says one thing, and you trust him/company and next day another person/department says complete opposite and ruins you. They cancel your account, deny your payout, everything. The day i asked the support (is my account terminated? i want to know now) was 14/11/2024. The date they told me everything was terminated was 24/11/2024. I've waited 10 days! Do you want to work with a company like this? You pro-actively question your status and some person assures you, "everything is ok. go back to trading" you give everything to make money for yourself and the company and after 10 days, some other person says that you are failed?And one last thing. Things move so slow there that, once you request a payout and if that's the only account you have, you have to wait until you are cleared. They don't even come up with a simple idea like: "Ok, you requested a payout. While we examine your trades, here's your account reset back to original balance. Go and trade. And if there is a violation on the previous one, we will talk" Is it that hard? No, you should patiently wait until somebody clears you. I am sure there are firms that can do that and definetly this will be on my checklist when i choose my next firm.So please beware.---(This is my response to company's reply. Original content is above and is untouched)Hey FT,Yes, your staff's mistake cost me 10 days. That is irreversible lost. You offered me complimentart re-try but i didn't want it because i don't want to experince this again.And as for TradeLocker, everything you say is true. Furthermore, when it comes to risk management and budgeting, that's the best tool available. And i am gonna miss these features. But, i don't know where that liquidty coming from but that liquidty (or lack thereof) is source of all kind of problems. Nobody request you a guarentee when it comes to stop losses but anybody who have used a decent broker with MT4/5 will acknowledge that at normal times these tools/services rarely slips. And yours is unreliable.Have a good day.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, While we acknowledge the mistake of our support staff, any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination. Trade locker uses depth of market in filling orders which makes it accurate to live trading conditions with regards to slippages. Additionally, stop losses are not guaranteed at the exact price you placed, these only stop orders which are filled at the best price possible. The best price possible is dependent on the liquidity and volatility at any moment.

reviews.title: The most evil prop firm going
reviews.content: Please stay away. This prop firm is evil. I just reached my profit target on a 100k 1 step challenge and was immediately failed due to a "consistency" rule. What's evil is the apparent rule was broken on Oct 24th but i was not disqualified. They continued to let you trade thinking everything is good and when you finally think you passed they comb your account to find errors to fail you. Everyone knows the mental and emotional toll trading takes and when you fail a challenge its gut wrenching. BUT to think you passed and to put all the work in only to fail you when you think you've succeeded is evil on another level. I have screenshots of everything including the conversation if anyone would like to review them yourselves DM me. Also I reported them to my Credit card company as fraud and was instantly re-imbursed for anyone else in the same boat. Apparently credit card companies love going after prop firm companies. Who knew.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Justin, We have 3 different scans -Live scanning: during taking the challenge -Post challenge scanning: analyzing your trade logs -Manual review: before getting to the funded stage or after requesting for a payout Even if the system didn't instantly automatically mark your account as "Failed" after a violation, your account will still be reviewed after completing the challenge phases. Any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination.

As a firm principle, we require all our traders to strictly adhere to the established rules to maintain consistency and fairness across all accounts. It is essential for us to uphold the integrity of our trading rules to ensure a level playing field for all traders. In your case, you had multiple trades that only lasted less than 15 seconds, which violates our anti HFT rule, this is why your account has been marked as "Failed".

reviews.title: hidden rules; open 2 positions same pair -> account gets terminated
reviews.content: I really liked Fundingtraders.com approach and i believed in their CEOs words how he is for the traders. The way they handle their TOS is absolutely unhuman!They have this rule if you have a position running and its slightly into profit and you open another bigger lot size your account is terminated. But they wont tell you until the risk management team looks into your account. Meaning you can be wasting your time completing a challenge only to know afterwards your account has violated a rule which no other prop firm has! Both positions together where far away from 2% DD and they were open for only 13 seconds(!!!) before i closed the 2nd one again. So even by mistake if you happen to open another position and its bigger even if its a reasonable size (1 and 2 lot on a 50k on a no news day and my usual size was 4 lot) you are screwed with them.Really sad story I expected more. If you claim you are for the traders then at least give a warning and explain the problem offer a free reset or anything! And first and foremost inform the trader immidiatly! I happened to ask them because someone told me about hidden rules and I found out after digging into every of their TOS.UPDATE - > answer to your answer:You state, I quote 2024-10-16: "To clarify, we've stated that a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first.You may add as many positions as you want on a winning trade"I can only add up to a losing trade idea but a line below you say I can add up to a winning position as much as I want??? You contradict yourself even within 3 sentences.Thank you for putting it so clear how random this rule is.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Matthias, To clarify, we've stated that a trader may only add up to one position on an already losing trade idea. This position may not be of a larger size than the first. You may add as many positions as you want on a winning trade. This is not a hidden rule. This is clearly stated in our Help Center  under the section "Important Trading Rules for your Evaluation, Funded, and Affiliate Account", titled "Are Martingale Systems and Arbitrage Trading allowed?" Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: A Complete Scam Designed to Fail You!!
reviews.content: I am writing this from experience with them and after losing several accounts of various stages. Funding Traders is a trap from start to finish. They use three different tactics to ensure you never succeed:- Live Scanning: During the challenge, they monitor your trades, looking for any minor excuse to fail you.- Post-Challenge Scanning: Even after you pass, they dig through your trading logs to find any small issue to disqualify you.- Manual Review: Before you get funded, they do a final review just to ensure you never reach the payout stage.This firm is designed to cheat you out of your money. No matter how well you trade, they will find a way to block your success. Stay far away!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Abdullah, The scanning process was placed to make sure no violations will go undetected. We are not just looking for minor excuses to fail our traders. Note that we will never fail an account or deny a payout without a breach of our TOS. As a firm principle, we require all our traders to strictly adhere to the established rules to maintain consistency and fairness across all accounts. It is essential for us to uphold the integrity of our trading rules to ensure a level playing field for all traders.

reviews.title: I feel robbed

They failed me as soon as I hit target and I was beyond myself. Contacted customer support and they were useless. Ignoring what I was explaining to them, and telling me that I breached due consistency rule. If I breached it then why didn’t you guys shut the account down straight away ? Why wait until I hit my profit target.? Honestly I feel robbed and I can see why that prop firms are starting to disappear. Ah well karmas a thing hey

Any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination.

reviews.title: Fundingtraders blocks by any reasons
reviews.content: Fundingtraders is a prop company that blocks clients' accounts under fictitious pretexts.Before delving into my problem, you need to understand what martingale trading isMartingale trading implies increasing the risk after a losing position, that is, fixing the loss and you must trade in one direction.For example, if you get a stop of 0.25%, the position doubles and the size of the stop-loss will be 0.5%, and so on.For those who doubt, open Google, this is exactly what is written there.Further.I went through an account for $ 10,000, as a test, to understand whether the company really pays, but now I understand that the guys block accounts under any pretext.And here the question is not whether this is a small account or I decided to raise a fuss out of thin air. In general, is there such a precedent to save the funds of other traders who want to undergo a larger test in this prop company, for example 100k accounts.Blocked account number: 822295I'm attaching deals for which, I believe, the account was blocked.The difference between the positions is 0.01 lot, which means that the prop will block your accs by any for any reasons.Was there a martingale in these deals?Definitely - NOIn these positions, I did not exceed the acceptable risk of 2%, per deal or trading idea.In fact, the position size was increased with a total risk not exceeding the stop-loss size of even 1%.I would like to draw attention to the fact that when purchasing an account, we accept the rules, which state the following:- Acceptable risk of 2% per idea- Acceptable drawdown of 5% and 10% per day and the total account size, respectively.Not a word about the fact that it is forbidden to trade using martingale. This is not the first time that a case like mine has happened, I personally know other traders who have encountered a similar problem.Even if they don't return my account, I want to protect other users from cooperating with this prop company.

reviews.title: Unfair Account Cancellation and Rule Violation Claim
reviews.content: I participated in a challenge from this company and, after successfully passing both Phase 1 and Phase 2, I was waiting to receive the funding account. However, after two days, I received an email stating that I had violated the rules in Phase 1 and that my account had been canceled.I emailed them about the issue, but they did not resolve the problem and claimed that I had engaged in Martingale betting. However, their claims and reasons were not related to Martingale betting at all.If the rules were indeed violated in Phase 1, why didn’t they notify me at that stage? Instead, they allowed me to pass both Phase 1 and Phase 2 before canceling my account.They did nothing to compensate for my loss and the time I invested in passing the challenges. I strongly advise against using this prop firm for challenges as they seem to be looking for any excuse to invalidate your challenge.

reviews.title: BAD SRVICES AND LACK OF…
reviews.content: BAD SRVICES AND LACK OF RESPONSIBILITIES. Especially Leo, Khalifa and etc...They said you can hold on weekend, but as a trader, you should be warned that spread could occurs during the open Asia session.But, I've seen my account been violated, about consistency rules of reaching the limit of $500. But how this could happen if I had a Stop loss that should've normally be respected ?.But what they're decided, is to say that they won't reinstate my account. What a lack of services, responsibilities !As a good and honest company, they should have given back the account, and warned the traders. Because my stop loss didn't been triggered as it should have. So in this case, wouldn't see the price running over my stop loss settled. So my question is, why stop loss should exist if we can not trust the ssyste to recognize that is there a Stop or take profit?. We are not talking about slippage on trading news event, but stop didn't been respected at the market opening. It's not the responsibility of the trader, but it's on the company to ensure that traders are safe with the company and the system.But they blame me for this and insist that they won't reinstate my account.I want to aware any traders here who want to  trade with thus company that, they don't respect what they saying, and you could see yourself be lose your account based on consistency and hidden rules which are not on your fault. My stop loss has been triggered as it should have, and they refuse to understand and reinstate my account. I have trusted them before, but not anymore after this.I'm very disappointed.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Arnold, As stated on your Discord ticket, note that different brokers may offer different market conditions due to their difference in liquidity providers. In your case, you violated the Consistency Rule due to spreads sudden widening during market rollover. Spreads widening during market rollover which can result to trades closing past your stop orders are normal. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.content: They have a hidden rule of 2% loss, if you have a 2% loss, they close your account. In other words, it is not 5% as they claim in the game, do not buy here, it is a fraud. reviews.reply_content: Hey Monica, The Consistency Rule states that the max. risk/loss (including floating loss) per trade idea is 2% of the initial account balance. You can still utilize up to 4/5% daily drawdown, just not on one trade idea. Your claim that we are a scam company is simply not true. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: Was up 1.2% in my 100k account and was…

Lost my 2 phase due to “Consistency rule” after adding another trade on a winning trade, but was also taken out by slippage which made me loose my account. Told them about all this and they did nothing. No prop firm is worth nothing if slippage and customer support is this bad.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Joshua, Slippage is when a trade didn't close exactly at your take profit or stop loss order. As explained in our email communication, there's no slippage as you placed no stop loss on the trade idea that violated the consistency rule.

reviews.title: Scam scam scam
reviews.content: Scam scam scam, I have bought 6 challenges from different prop firms and on Friday I passed my first account after 46 trading days and when I pass they denied me my funded account, I did not break any rules they just denied my my funded account They said and I quote Hey Ali, Congratulations on passing the $100,000 account challenge (7415322703).Upon further review of your account, we noticed that it relied heavily on overleveraged short scalps with uniformity in trades lasting all within the 1-minute range. Your phase 2 account also showed an abnormally large number of trade positions in a very short time frame of 1 -2 minutes while being able to switch directions smoothly. Also, there seems to be a uniformity in all trades.This is deemed unrealistic and will have a hard time recreating in normal trading conditions as we have to copy trade from a master account. This method will eat up profit due to latency and fees considering the high lot size used in a short amount of time. Unfortunately, we are uncomfortable proceeding with the funded account especially noting the nature and uniformity of trades used in the challenge phase of the account. Resolution:Due to this, we will not be able to advance this account to the next stage. Your account will receive a full refund on evaluation fees. We also recommend you go through our help center or our TOS to get a better understanding of our platform's rules and objectives.Thanks for your understanding and I hope to hear from you.Best Regards,Risk Management at FundingTradersHow can they denied my account after I spent such a long time trying to pass it, I trade, I did not over leverage I risk 1% to make 2% but they don’t want to give away funded accounts so they give excuses I don’t have a lot of money so this money would of changed my life for ever I work a full time job making 2k a month and a funded account would change everything, and when I finally pass my account they denied my dream, I had to trade in the toilet at work and that’s why the trades where short
reviews.reply_content: Hey Muhammed, All of these are based on the review of our Risk Department. We're a prop firm, we're on a hunt for traders we can actually back with real capital in the long term. Please note that you didn't violate any of our trading rules or objectives, this is why we offered as full refund.

reviews.title: Rules setup to make you fail
reviews.content: It seems like props are adding rules in hopes you fail. To clarify, I passed phase 1 and was immediately given my phase 2 challenge. I passed phase 2 and in the review stage it was determined I actually failed phase 1. I didn’t gamble and never risked more than 1% per OPEN trade. This company has rules for “trade ideas”. If you open a trade less than 2 minutes after closing a trade they then count those 2 trades as 1 trade idea ( or 1 trade I guess?). They total the 2 trades together and if you breach 2% with those 2 trades then they fail you. They know most traders risk 1% per trade so they were intentional with setting up that rule.  I spent hundreds on challenges with them and was excited to complete the challenges and felt I did quite well. Well, turns out I opened a losing trade 30 seconds too soon. So because I opened my losing trade 1:35 minutes after closing a trade I am a risky trader lol. If I would have taken the same loss at 2:01 then woohoo you pass! The two losses were 20 minutes apart. Many traders in the chat thought that rule meant you can lose 2% in 2 minutes. Nope, doesn’t matter if the actual losses are hours apart. You just can’t open the trades within 2 minutes of closing another. So that is “risky” to them yet they allow news trading… I wonder why because all other props I’ve traded don’t allow news trading. Oh yeah, because you open up to gamblers who can lose quite fast and easily during news. But be careful. Because they have a clause that states if you rely “too heavily” during news you can fail as well. I saw an instance of this happening in the Discord to someone that made a profit from news. Another reason to fail a profitable trader. Such an arbitrary and useless rule, and just checking the discord you can see how new traders are also going through the same denial because of the 2 minute rule. They won’t fail you after phase 1. I had to waste time doing phase 2 for them to tell me I failed for phase 1.

reviews.title: My Costly Experience with Uninformed Trading Rules
reviews.content: I took a challenge for the 100k account, no problems with the phase 1 or 2, everything was fine, the problem starts with the consistency rule when I got my master account, the problem comes when at no time was I informed by discord or email of the new consistency rules of 2% of the account in a margin of 2 MINUTES, as soon as I obtained the master account I had trades where I was in more than 2% daily drawdown because of not knowing at any time this new rule of waiting 2 minutes before opening operations again.The thing with this company is that you do not lose the account immediately, which means trading for days thinking that you have complied with all the rules, having lost the account where you are still trading, resulting in a loss of time for the trader.Eventually I was able to actually obtain benefits of $1500, when I proceeded to request the withdrawal of this benefit is when they let you know that you have lost count due to this rule.My overall experience is bad because I was trading for 1 week obtaining profit, while my account was already lost, having therefore lost a week of work due to the way this company works, so in total I gave them 1 week of my time, and $1500, of my profit.

reviews.title: Slippage to breach consistency  rule AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviews.content: Take note. You are lucky to be reading this because Funding Traders have done everything they can to flag my review. They blocked me on discord and refused to give me the the data on where my stops where placed. Its a scam. you set the stop loss to be within 2% max loss per one trade and then they hit you with huge slippage. They dont tell you until you pass and then they fail you. What a flipping joke of a prop firm. It will not show you failed on consistency unless you pass folks and they gave me a massive slip on Bitcoin .. all the trading logs shows the stops i set. Avoid and save yourself the time you will waste. Beware they will leave you to pass before they hit you with a consistency violation of their creation. I set my stop losses I wasted 9 extra days completing the exam to be told sorry we slipped your position. My advice is go somewhere else for your prop challenges.  And good luck with your trading journey.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Wiz, Trade locker uses depth of market in filling orders while mt5 does not. This makes TL accurate to live trading conditions with regards to slippages. Additionally, stop losses are not guaranteed at the exact price you placed, these only stop orders which are filled on the best price possible. The best price possible is dependent on the liquidity and volatility at any moment. Also note that there are additional trading rule violation review after completing the challenge phases.

reviews.title: Unreasonable way to fail a trader
reviews.content: I trust Fundingtraders is a good firm until they told me I Copy Trade with other. The proof they gave are 5 instances where my trades found similar to another person. There are no way those are copy trades, as the trade results are far different due to above factors. Yet, still FT does not accept as the other person and me share certain similarities. This is not convincing at all, and cause my account failed and forfeited my 5k profit. This is very unfair.#(updated)To Fundingtraders: I understand the rule, and will comply with it without complaining. But as you see, both 5 trades pairs are not entry and exit at the same time and with different volumes, hence the trades result far different. They are not Copy Trade, as there is no point doing it. They are just coincidence.
reviews.reply_content: Dear Huu, Keep in mind that we will never fail an account without a breach of our TOS. Our Team has carefully examined your account, and our findings shows that you copy traded with another account. This is why your account has been marked as "Failed". As a firm principle, we require all our traders to strictly adhere to the established rules to maintain consistency and fairness across all accounts. I place orders according to the zone. and place 2-3 orders in that zone with equal volume with total SL ensuring no loss beyond the regulation. reviews.title: Hi everyone
reviews.content: Hi everyone,I recently conducted a test on this platform with a starting balance of $10,000, and I would like to share my experience and some advice.Overall, my trades were successful, with only one negative outcome, and I managed to achieve a 10% profit by the second day. However, my risk management system wasn't accepted, even though I only opened one position at a time. I opened a second position only after closing the first one with a profit. It’s essential to remember that the maximum you can risk is 2% of your initial balance per trade. I recommend limiting your risk to 1.5% per trade with a stop-loss of $100 to $150 to help safeguard your profits.It's important to focus on consistency and long-term profitability rather than aiming for large daily gains.This platform offers excellent opportunities for skilled CFA traders, and the customer support is commendable. While it may take some time to receive a response, they address all inquiries (just avoid being too persistent).I would like to extend my gratitude to a great support representative named Magnesium, who assisted me with what I can only assume was Australian enthusiasm. :)Thank you, everyone, and thank you, Magnesium! :)

reviews.title: 2 Minutes limit for trading in one trading area :-(((
reviews.content: Hi there!GOOD AND BAD experience in my case. Please read below... and be very careful with this limitation.BAD:On a good way to fulfill the 1st step of a challenge, my account was suspended immediately. NO WARNING - NOTHING! Dow Jones had yesterday a great rebounce after drop down. I went LONG on a quite good level with DJ. Closed and opened again a trade, no doubling. Sometimes SL or TP were catched within less than 1-2 minutes. I wanted to be sure and on the safe side always, looking if we can keep the trend. Therefore I had around 5-6 trades within 10 minutes, some of them were shorter than 2 minutes.Why did FUNDING TRADES suspend my account.I was not allowed - in the same area, which was DJ - to close a TRADE and open the next TRADE earlier than 2 MINUTES. Also it is not allowed to close a trade within 15 SECONDS in general.So I had the 10.000 USD account (challenge) around 24 hours. Payed 100 USD for that, I had within 15 minutes already +7% (700 USD) and was suspended... GOOD THINGEyare, from the Support team of Funding Traders had a lot of patience and explained to me that possible problem in detail via CHAT. As nobody answered since yesterday on my mail, to explain the details about my suspension. EYARE is very kind and nice person. Thank you for taking time for the detailed explanation.Probably FUNDING TRADERS can unlock my account and let me finish the challenge, after the detailed explanation. In the CONSISTENCY RULES it is described unclearly...RegardsAlex

reviews.title: Manipulation
reviews.content: Trade locker under the guise of FundingTraders deletes my trades whenever it deems fit, it also constantly widens the spread when it reaches my orders leaving them untriggered, this week I edited an open trade that was in profit and afterwards it was immediately closed. When my stops are hit it seems losses are always larger than anticipated but this doesn't seem to happen when profits are reached. TradeLocker charts are also designed to game your stops, when you have multiple accounts you'll notice 200 pip stops are reached on their platform before other accounts even get activated, I experiemced this again yesterday so i moved my entry since price was close to it whilst being miles away on my other accounts. Tradelocker responded by saying the firms are the ones who manipulate trades, so I reached out to Funding Traders support with this and they said I must go make a review on their discord with my disgruntlements. Now they think I'm unaware they block negative reviews on discord so at least I have this place to share with the world where they can't control the narrative.I noticed that most reviews are about their fast customer service when people are handing over their money for challenges. Go figure. FTMO and other older firms are still the best with no shenanigans when trading. Giiving these newer firms a chance always proves a waste of resources and it's clear they survive off rookies who can't tell when their trading conditions are rigged. Whether it's them or Tradelocker, I'll never know but one thing is for sure, someone is out to get us.Update: I did some research and learned that firms who rig trading conditions do so by using a Virtual Dealer Plugin. It maximizes unfavorable slippage by further delaying entries and stops. It also cancels positive slippage in the traders favor by either rejecting the order outright or places the trade back at its original requested price negating any positive slippage.As if the markets aren't already tough enough.
reviews.reply_content: Your claim that "TradeLocker operates under the guise of FundingTraders" is simply not true. TradeLocker uses depth of market in filling orders which makes it accurate to live trading conditions with regards to commission, fees, slippages. Also keep in mind that the market filling conditions are dependent on the liquidity at the moment, and is not manipulated by us.

reviews.title: Professional but VERY high slippage on trades
reviews.content: So far this is the most competent and professional service i have used. Challenges are good value. BUT, and there is a big but, the profit you see in a live trades never actually materialises to your P&L. Every single trade i have closed at a (profit) the closing profit has quite significantly changed when it appears in my trade summary. All these moments add up. Sure, they will claim slippage but on every single trade?! I have not seen it before when i have traded live funds to this extreme. The losses also increase when your SL gets hit often more than the set amount which makes risk management tricky. This is my only gripe as i am enjoying trading on Trade Locker and the customer service is good

reviews.reply_content: All of our trading rules are available in the TOS and Help Center. They are even labeled under "Important Trading Rules". Our anti-martingale rule just tells traders to avoid doubling down on a losing trade (we allow traders to add to winners). Doubling down on losers is a dangerous risk management style that many traders use to gamify the evaluation model.

reviews.title: They are using contradictory phrases in their articles
reviews.content: I bought a $50k account, and after some time I reached around $50,900 in the first stage. Then I went long 3 lots in silver, which initially showed a $400 loss due to unfair spreads. It then went to a $790 loss, at which point I opened another long with 3 lots with a $400 loss at the beginning!!! After 1 minute, they closed my positions and sent an email stating that I was breaching their consistency rules!!!! My two trades had losses of $790 and $405 I called support and asked why this happened to my account? They told me that based on the article, I had breached their rules! It is funny because the article did not mention the 2% loss limit on all similar positions! At the beginning of the article, they mentioned no more than 2% loss per trade, which means I did not breach this rule. But at the end of the article, they used a new invented phrase called "Trade Idea". I asked them what they meant by "trade idea"? They said a trade idea means a setup!!!!! I was wondering and asked them why they didn't use the term "Setup"? Then the representative started explaining to me what they considered a trade idea. So I told them why didn't they include this explanation in the article? Then he told me instead of complaining, I should buy another challenge!!!I wonder he didn’t answer me anymore !! Can you believe it! My recommendation is don't buy from them, as they use contradictory rules to take our money and confuse us. This kind of company and customer service just ruins the entire business.Pat was the guy who supposed to solve the issue with theirs contradictory rules .I am really upset that I experienced such an occasion in my life, more than the money that I lost in just 30 minutes.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Mohamad, Our Consistency Rule has been 2% per trade idea since the beginning of our operations. Your claim that we invented a new phrase with regards to your violation is simply not true. Ignorance of the rules doesn't exempt you from it. Due diligence is important as a trader.

reviews.title: PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COST!!
reviews.content: PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COST!!This prop firm is a waste of time and resources. I paid for the 7-day payout add-on when I purchased my account and have now been denied payout twice. The first time they claimed that I did not trade much on the account which makes no sense after because I traded 2 days out of 5 trading days, traders should be allowed to trade according to their edge and trade plan, but they claimed I did not take enough trades for them to access my performance when they already accessed my trading in the evaluation phase. This was wrong because they advertised 7-day payouts as an add-on. I decided to keep trading the account and made more profits. When I requested a payout the second time, the excuse they gave me was that I traded news and they do not allow traders to "heavily rely on the news" although they allow news trading. However, the trades they claim were taken during news were not opened or closed at the time of a news event. USDCAD was closed 3 hours before the news, I was in EURJPY before the news and closed out before the news event. The bottom line is that they would find reasons not to pay you. Please Please Please!! Save your money and time. There are better options out there.

reviews.title: Reliable prop firm
reviews.content: FundingTrader is definitely one of the few reliable prop firms. I started trading with them because they still provided MT5. I could choose a 90% profit split. I took a $100,000 one-step account and was able to get it for around $360 with their running discount, the lowest price in the industry, I know.I had a shocking first day as my two gold limit orders were executed and closed in less than a second, and I was in drawdown. I contacted customer service, and they said it was a system error and put the money back in my account. It had only been a few days since they moved to their new broker, and I was a bit worried at first. But as days went by, my trading experience got much better. I never experienced slippage on market orders and had very clean executions(I trader 5-10 lots GOLD)I finished my evaluation, got my live account, and completed the KYC process the same day. The customer service is really great. The customer chat box is always open like a friend waiting to help you. Special mention to Magnesium; he has been my support from the start, always proficient in sorting out my concerns. I think he is also a trader, so he understands the problems as if they were his own and takes necessary action. He's never in a rush and always provides great support. He talks to you like a friend, always cheering and greeting.Overall, great stuff so far. I haven't requested a payout yet, but following the Discord channel, I see there are no problems with payouts. I will update here on my first payout experience.The only thing I did not like is the 5% drawdown. The rest is fantastic.

reviews.title: Pretty Great And Would Recommend
reviews.content: I've had a great experience so far with FundingTraders with one issue. I try to be as honest as possible, so outside of this issue things have been perfect. However, the problem was big enough to lose a star.I completed my 10% eval and 5% verification for a $100,000 challenge. However, I wasn't verified for the funded account because it was stated that I broke the 2% total drawdown on one of my trades. I DID NOT have an issue if I broke a rule.The issue was that the infraction was during the 10% evaluation, yet after getting 10% and yet another 5%, none of it counted which is unfortunate. It would have been much better to "flunk" the 10% eval than to get 10% and then 5% only to be told that something I did days ago disqualified me.I've been very happy with the service team and there are new developments with their services and offerings which is why I had no problem getting a new evaluation with them. I think they are a top-notch firm, I just wish they would catch an infraction when it happens so that a person doesn't waste time and trades on an evaluation they can't pass. I can't imagine if it took me weeks to get through, but luckily it was just a couple of days.I'm sticking with them as my #1 firm, just be conscious of that 2% rule and they will review your account upon request if you think you have an infraction.

reviews.title: The biggest legal scam of all prop…
reviews.content: The biggest legal scam of all prop firms, they've got hidden consistency rule in FAQ (you can't drawdown more than 2% of your capital in one position) although your daily drawdown is 5% and you haven't get to that limit you will lose the account. To be able to find this rule you need to dig in their FAQ rules. As this is very crucial rule this should be visible so every trader can see it in advance not afterword's when is too late. According to be this is a trap! At lease they should offer you a free new challenge if you have failed the 2% consistency rule if they are genuine prop firm and really want to earn from trading but not from failed traders so here we are they want to get you in their trap and than take your money due to this 2% consistency rule.

reviews.title: I bit lengthy but this was my…
reviews.content: I bit lengthy but this was my experience. I went with them because they accept U.S. clients and seemed to have the most favorable conditions.Took me 3.5 weeks to pass both phases. After I passed phase 1 on MT5 they swapped me to Tradelocker for phase 2. Not sure why but there seems to be some kind of back end issue with companies for US clients using MT4/5. Seems to be this way with any firm and U.S. clients. Regardless, I hated Tradelocker initially but then in time got used to it and now I'm fine with it. But I passed and they funded me.  (Note: be aware of the 2% rule. You can't lose more then 2% on any trade/ trade idea or you fail. I hated this at first but in time started to like it as it just lowers the risk/stress on my trades.)On my funded account on day 1 I took a heavy loss , I was tired from my other job and just messed up, spent the rest of the week clawing back to finish the week at +700. I cashed out and they paid me in 24hrs. I followed the rules, passed the test, got funded, was profitable eventually, and got paid. Customer support was there to help when I needed it. So they got 5 stars from me.  For U.S. clients looking for a new place this is worth checking out.

reviews.title: Stay away from this company. They don't make big payouts.
reviews.content: I decided to tell my sad story about the payment on FT.In short, they screwed me over.It all started when I requested a withdrawal from them and they responded to me within 4 days. Then they gave up and said that everything is ok with the trades, we are ready to pay you, but only on Rise. Rise is not available in the Russian Federation and probably, as it seems to me, there was already an expectation here to weed me out. I registered Rice with my friend, and we waited for the approval of the docks for 4 days, today is the 5th and they still haven’t responded to us via verification.Another friend came to the rescue and we thought about withdrawing through his rice. Yesterday I sent it to them and then the most interesting thing began. They disappeared again, it is worth noting that they generally responded with an interval of 20 hours on average. Today Rob came back to me and said that supposedly we checked your accounts and discovered copy trading, since you traded the same pairs in the same sessions, provided that the entry price and Opening Time differ by more than 2 minutes in transactions, which in general according to them the same rules is an excellent trading idea. In general, as a result, I received an account block and a refusal to withdraw.The most interesting thing is that as I communicated with Rob, I told him, let’s make the final decision, so that I can go to their discord chat and to the chats of other traders that I am a member of, but they kicked me from the server and banned me. This is the story guys.
reviews.reply_content: Hey Trader, Keep in mind that we will never deny a payout without a breach of our TOS. Copy trading is not allowed, and it is clearly stated on our Help Center. Any point a violation is detected, the account is due for termination.

reviews.title: As far as prop firms go
reviews.content: As far as prop firms go, its not a bad one. In house technology, they copy profitable traders (apparently) so they should be having enough capital in the back to pay out their funded traders. Website layout isnt bad. But if you fail a challenge, with an open position, you will get spammed with margin call emails. Multiple a day, from FundingTraders and the broker/application (cTrader in my case). There is nothing you can do, and support doesnt reply to you. Also, i highly recommend not using their MT5 platform. They dont have their MT5 platform available for PC. i could not find a download link, nor was i sent one. They use Acqua Markets as their broker. Horrible execution times, massive spreads, and bad server connection all led me to failing my challenge. e.g. While i was on mobile, on a chart, i clicked either buy or sell. Nothing showed up on the chart. Clicked it a couple more times, still nothing. Waited a minute or 2 in case it was my internet on my end, tried opening another. Still nothing showed on the chart. Then i went onto my open positions, and i had about 7 positions open due to the poor quality of the broker. Happened to me twice. fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me. So i will not be fooled again and i will not be using fundingtraders againThey can say "its our broker, its not us", but they chose to go with the broker. Edit: Unsubscribed from fundingtraders/cTrader alerts, and im still getting email alerts about margin from an account that i can not use as the access is disabled. Will not be revisiting.

reviews.title: Lies, lies and more lies!
reviews.content: I have been taking my time on this funded challenge, and everything was going okay. Then the first thing that happened out of the blue was that I was switched from Blueberry Markets, to CBT-Limited MT5 platform, just like that. Fine. Then yesterday, I place any early a.m. trade...no problem. Then I open up Tradingview for the Asia session, and no CBT- Limited even listed, other than my old credentials showing up, And the only broker choice available was a TradeLocker account. Look up their reviews for yourself. They ARE HORRIBLE! 2.3 out of 5 stars. Sign me up! And the customer service rep, named Magnesium" just keeps lying and stringing you along. First it would be 12-24 hours and it would be resolved. 28 hours late, I inquire. " Oh, I'm so sorry. I've answered so many questioned today. yours just scrolled up and I forgot." "Here are your credentials. If you have anymore issues, don't hesitate to contact me. Three hours later, after I have let "Magnesium" know that I still can't access the platform (36 hours now, not 12-24), all I hear is crickets. I have screen shots of all this. DO NOT TRUST THESE SCAMMERS! YOU WILL LOSE YOUR $!!! By the way, I had the 50k account up to $53,618.12, so more than half way through phase 1. Update: 4/11/2024Well... it seems that I've talked sh** prematurely. Whoever Magnesium is really did get it worked out. Turns out that they really were inundated with complaints and concerns from people having, most likely, the exact same experience that I was having. Thank you FundingTraders, and especially to whoever Magnesium is. I made a rush to judgement. I have recently lost a lot of money due to prop firms suddenly closing. I am sure that I am not the only one, but I do apologize for my impatience. I have amended my 1 star rating to 5 stars. I am still not sure about TradeLocker. FundingTraders trust them, so I will give them a try.

I refused their proposed downgrade of my originally paid-for account for 500k with 100% profit split addon to 200k ("due to risk to them"), because if they pulled that kind of thing now what else can they do later...I am posting a complete conversation between me and that shady "prop" firm support/review team [the conversation starts from the bottom].Hopefully, someone will find it helpful_______________________________________________"Mikhail 10:11 PM (28 minutes ago)to FundingTraders, supportThank you.  On my side, I will make sure this conversation and my account details will be shared with prop review companies and forums, so people would be aware. Also, I passed the challenge not in 1 day but in 50 trades over multiple weeks with only a 2% overall max drawdown and the 2nd phase with a 1% drawdown with all my positions secured by s/l, how is that a high risk? I trade SMC with bank levels with high reliability on volume and divergence. If you don't like the lot size I used then why do you offer a 1:100 margin on forex?  I only agree with the full 500k account as I paid for and spent my time working for in accordance with with your rules.  I am funded by other firms and 200k is a waste of time for me in the matter of time spent to reward gained ratio. Otherwise, I require a full refund because that would be a risk for me to stay with a company violating its own rules.Respectfully, Mikhail On Sun, Mar 31, 2024, 21:17 FundingTraders Help  wrote:Hey Mikhail,Congratulations on passing the $500,000 account challenge.Upon further review of your account, we noticed that the account strategy used for trading relies heavily on aggressive short scalps. Large spreads on Nasdaq and Sp5002. The price of Nasdaq and sp500 differs by about 0.5%3. The 2% rule, but if you break it, they don’t delete your account or even notify you.4. Commissions that are not included in this rule.5. Technical support is rude.6. Refunds are not possible if 2 weeks have passed, even if you have not opened a single transaction.P.S. I also bought an account where when you trade in, you get a second one as a gift. but there is no information about this, it is unclear who to write to and who to ask.

reviews.title: Beware if you're an experienced trader that can manage big accounts.. they DOWNSCALE 300k + Accounts
reviews.content: I am a professional trader funded with multiple prop firms managing over 2m in funding and after looking to add another one to my list, I picked FT as my next target because of the great reviews and promo code "MATCH" that gives a free account of the same size upon reaching payout.I purchased a 300k 1-Step Challenge in order to get a total of 600k in funding with the promo and passed it with a total of 2100 pips in profit, 19 trades with an average R/R of 4.8 which in trading would be considered as amazing stats.It took me only 8 trading days** or just about 2 weeks to make the 10% profit target and had a maximum drawdown of 2.10% which again, would be considered as great trading stats. FT has a 14 days minimum trading rule so I finished the 6 remaining days by taking micro trades to not risk bringing the account below the 10% profit target.Upon verification of my successful challenge, I received an email from Rio of the risk team mentioning they would DOWNSCALE my account to 200k because of the micro trades I took during those 6 remaining days. They also mentioned I had not used a Stop Loss on some of my trades which as per their FAQ is NOT mandatory anyway! This is an absolute RED FLAG and a doubtful, deceiving unprofessional practice for this industry.There are no rules in the FAQ about micro trades being an issue. Also, I have done the same thing with multiple prop firms in the past and without any issues. Furthermore, my trading stats and quality trades clearly prove I was not gambling. Bottom line is, I passed the challenge 100% within the guidelines and FAQ of the company and should be provided with the 300k funded account I purchased. The automatic downscale should be regarded as a red flag by any experienced traders out there. Even after disputing their decision and talking with the team, they denied giving my full 300k funded account. That being said, I will trade the 200k provided to me for now and we'll see if they also provide me with a free 300k account as promised with their "MATCH" promotion.For reference, here is a Copy/Paste of the email that was sent to me by FundingTraders.“ Hey Sam,Congratulations on passing the $300,000 account challenge.Upon further review of your account, we noticed that the trading objectives was completed in 8 days, and after that micro-lots were used to pass the minimum trading days of 14 days for a $300,000 account.Combined with this, some trades have no stop loss. This is regarded as a moderate risk in our platform. Moving forward, we are offering to downscale your account to a $ 200,000-funded account. This resolution helps us manage our risk based on our performance assessment and gathering more data on your trader, while, on your end, also being able to start making money on your funded account. The difference will be refunded back to your payment method used. Thanks for your understanding and I hope to hear from you.Best Regards,Rio Admin Head at FundingTraders”

reviews.title: Better than last month
reviews.content: This is my first payout along with a challenge refund after losing many challenges and funded accounts in other firms, so let me give you a detailed review of the firm.1. 100% split and 7-day payouts - Kudos to their team for introducing this as I don't see it anywhere else. I was thinking how is it possible? But seems like they would earn from us too if we are a good and consistent trader. Win-win for both of us.Most of the other firms only have bi-weekly and monthly payouts. I can't wait that long, personally. So I opted for a 7-day payout and is worth it. Not slow, not the fastest but looks perfect.2. Consistency ruleThere is a 2% trade idea rule which is one of a kind. Some people are calling it a strategy to stop people from making money but trust me if you are a trader, you can easily NOT break this rule. It is not that easy to manage a big firm without a rule like this, they care about their money as well as the trader's consistency. It's not that they take your challenge money after the rule failure, but provide a refund or a retake which itself tells why the rule is here in the first place. This rule has also improved my trading style, slowly getting away from gambling trades.Edit: Unfortunately, they removed the refunds option.3. DashboardThe dashboard is clean and simple which is comfortable to use but there is room for improvement as some details were missing. For example, an order receipt could have been there.4. Spreads and commissionsIf you are an intraday trader, the brokers (currently using - CBT) they use would provide you with a good environment to trade. For example, the spreads for indices are low and there are no commissions on indices even for funded phases. Swap rates are higher which is why I don't hold trades here but seems like this is the case with many brokers as well. I have not used Blueberry but I have heard of some good reviews around the Forex world. Check - ForexPeaceArmy.5. SupportI like the way the support is handled using Discord. I usually get all the answers within 5 minutes of opening a ticket. Some important tickets like Account Review and payouts can take up to 24 hours. You just have to use #submit-ticket on their Discord server instead of using General Chat which some people think is support and complain about no one responding there :DI will update you more on my journey with them as they keep on improving.Edit: 18-04-2024Right now, it is not looking good for the firm. Reasons being - 1. Tradelocker integrationIt is a good platform and I like their roadmap but it seems like the platform was integrated early as there were so many issues.2. New MT5 BrokerThe new MT5 broker is not popular, their homepage doesn't look trustworthy either.3. AdvertisementI wish they concentrate more on their platforms instead of marketing. A good user experience will automatically bring in new traders. Some of the advertisements looked like bait.4. Payout delaysThere were some payouts delayed for a week. It's not a good sign.But I hope they bounce back soon.Update - 18-05-2024cTrader integration -I am glad they introduced cTrader. I am now copying from MT4 to cTrader without any hassle. The trading conditions there are great too. I am not working with their other platforms, so I can't review based on them.Metrix update -The new metrix looks better than the previous one as you can track the consistency rule but the rest of the dashboard needs updates, I hope they are working on it too.
reviews.reply_content: Funded Trader Manoj! Thanks for your compliments - we appreciate it 100%. Your recommendation on the dashboard is noted down and we're currently working on the next update which will include order receipts and much more. We honestly can't wait to roll out this update! Have a great one Manoj!

reviews.title: Funding Traders offer 2% Hidden Equity Rule
reviews.content: Funding Traders offer 5% Daily draw down rule and that's obviously understand for every trader.And they also have a hidden rule called 2% Draw down per trade Rule.Also by having 5% daily equity draw down rule they also have 2% per trade equity rule and its hidden in all promotions and scamming Traders capital.Be careful Traders
reviews.reply_content: Hey Chinthaka, This rule is not "hidden" as you claim. This is called our consistency rule which is shown on the main website and our help center under "important trading rules". The goal for this rule is to make sure no traders are risking more than half of their daily drawdown in one single trade idea. Why? To push users trying to gamify the evaluation model by purchasing many accounts and taking 5-9% risk per trade just to get one to pass. Also, this gives us enough data from the user showing consistency in their performance. Instead of having a user pass the evaluation with 1-2 trades risking 5-8%. However, we understand that we will continue to work on making sure all objectives and rules are understood by the user before starting the challenge.

reviews.title: I passed my 100k challenge within 3…
reviews.content: I passed my 1step 100k challenge within 3 days with a very clear and simple strategy. I never received a warning about apparently taking a risky trade. I showed my strategy on email and I explained it clearlyI took a 15 lot, and 5 lot trade, the 5 lot being second entry, as I saw price came back and retested my zone providing more confluence. I had a good entry however, I was respecting the daily loss limit and exited the trade to reserve my account until the next day to execute a better trade with my other chosen pair XAUUSD.It's a shame, because I actually had hope in this firm but it's just another money grab prop firm, save your money and go to another TRUSTED firm thats been around for a while. Do NOT use fundingtraders.**EDIT**THAT RULE IS SO HIDDEN AND NOT MADE CLEAR BEFOREHAND! NO WARNING EMAIL WHATSOEVER FOR THAT WARNING. ALL UR STUDENTS ARE FROM SMALLER COUNTRIES AND IVE CHECKED THE DISCORD BARELY ANYONE IN THERE HAS A 100K+ FUNDED ACCOUNT!!!! NO HIGH PAYOUTS WHATSOEVER, WHICH IS WHAT IM CAPABLE OF!!
reviews.reply_content: Hey Salome, Upon reviewing this case, you violated the consistency rule. Our consistency rule states that a user must not risk more than 2% per position. The principle behind this rule is to make sure that traders are not risking more than half of their daily drawdown allowing them to showcase their edge and risk management skills throughout the evaluation. Its secondary purpose is to prevent users from gamifying the evaluation model. This rule was clearly violated and all the documentations were sent to your email. Options to retake the evaluation or a full refund was given since trading objectives were completed (but trading rules were violated). This rule is clearly stated on our website, FAQ/Help Center, TOS agreed upon purchasing the evaluation, and throughout our community servers/groups. A full refund of the evaluation fees has been sent since the option to retake the evaluation was not chosen. Wishing you the best in your journey!

This would have made my error clear directly after purchasing.Overall, their online platform is not very userfriendly and seems like it has been created with minimal thought to user experience.There is potential in this firm but they are still quite far away from the established players like FTMO.

reviews.title: Waste of time
reviews.content: This firm is a waste of time and will not fund you on larger accounts.I purchased a 200k account and passed both phases while respecting all of their trading objectives. They refused to open the live account for me because there were 2 separate trades, days apart, that ended up in -4.5% of the account. They stated that this is a “turbulent risk behavior” consistent with gambling. I used a consistent lot size throughout both phases. They should not claim to allow a max 5% daily loss if they in fact do not.They did end up refunding me which of course means they admitted that I didn’t violate any trading rules.I would like to point out that according to their Discord there are only 21 funded members in the whole firm. And most (not all) of the reviews on Trustpilot seem fake, they are from newly registered accounts where the name does not match the country.
reviews.reply_content: Hello, Our risk management department determined your trading style to be high risk and not suitable for our live funds. You only traded 1 pair and on 2nd stage only made 2 trades. This does not show us consistent safe trading style we're looking for. We have right to refuse traders who we do not want managing our capital. We are taking huge risk allowing you a $20k drawdown with your trading style. We wish you best of luck in future however. FT Team
